metadata.description: Code structure knowledge graph for Ancestry research automation platform. Documents classes, functions, modules, and their relationships (defines, calls, uses, instantiates).
metadata.scope: Complete project codebase analysis including core/*, actions, utilities, and AI integration layers.
metadata.recentUpdates: 2025-12-09: Documentation refresh (mission_execution_spec, todo plan, README alignment in progress).

documentation.primary: README.md - Comprehensive project documentation with Reserved for Future Development section
documentation.testing: test_examples/README.md - Test patterns and best practices
documentation.monitoring: docs/grafana/ - Grafana dashboards and setup scripts
documentation.audit: docs/DOCUMENTATION_AUDIT.md - Documentation quality analysis and best practices

reserved.description: Functions and classes that are fully implemented but not yet integrated into the main workflow. These represent future capabilities that are tested and ready for activation.
items: run_all_tests.TestResultCache - Test result caching for incremental testing
error_handling functions - 10+ structured error handling utilities

nodes.name: APIManager
nodes.summary: Encapsulates HTTP session management, CSRF handling, and retrieval of core user identifiers.
nodes.mechanism: Configures a pooled requests.Session, syncs cookies from BrowserManager, executes API calls with optional CSRF headers, and caches identifiers for SessionManager usage.
concerns: Identifier helpers assume legacy response schemas; brittle if upstream APIs change fields.
Session recovery path relies on SessionManager injection, so misuse outside orchestrated flow may fail silently.
opportunities: Add schema validation or typed responses to detect API contract drift early.
Emit telemetry on identifier retrieval failures to aid login troubleshooting.
nodes.notes: Handles cookie deduplication and optional cookie-file bootstrap for headless runs.

nodes.name: BrowserManager
nodes.summary: Owns Selenium WebDriver lifecycle, cookie readiness checks, and tab management for browser-required actions.
nodes.mechanism: Initializes Chrome via init_webdvr, navigates to base URL, loads stored cookies, minimizes window, tracks driver state, and exposes helpers for validation and cookie checks.
concerns: Cookie loader builds faux SessionManager object; future refactors could break attribute expectations.
Minimize fallback moves window off-screen, which may confuse remote desktop users.
opportunities: Expose structured status when start_browser fails to aid diagnostics integration.
Consider consolidating duplicate session-valid checks shared with SessionManager.
nodes.notes: Handles Chrome 142 minimization quirk and ensures safe teardown of driver handles.

nodes.name: DatabaseManager
nodes.summary: Encapsulates database file discovery, engine creation, pooling telemetry, and session orchestration.
nodes.mechanism: Resolves DB path from config, lazily initializes engine and sessionmaker, records performance stats, and offers context wrappers for batch and async work.
concerns: Duplicate logger setup hints at legacy refactors still in progress.
Adaptive pooling heuristics may be overkill for single-threaded actions and lack regression coverage.
opportunities: Consider injecting config manager to ease unit testing and reduce global state reliance.
Expose a pared-down interface for callers that just need ensure_ready/get_session to clarify supported usage.
nodes.notes: Designed to replace SessionManager's embedded DB logic during modularization efforts.

nodes.name: AppError
nodes.summary: Base structured exception carrying category, severity, user message, and contextual metadata.
nodes.mechanism: Initializes with ErrorCategory/Severity, auto-generates user guidance per category, and exposes to_dict for telemetry.
concerns: Instances hold arbitrary context dicts; callers must avoid sensitive data leaks.
opportunities: Add redaction helper for telemetry to prevent PII leakage.
nodes.notes: Base class for specialized errors (DatabaseError, NetworkError, etc.).

nodes.name: CircuitBreaker
nodes.summary: Thread-safe circuit breaker enforcing failure thresholds with half-open recovery checks.
nodes.mechanism: Wraps call attempts inside lock, tracks failure timestamps, transitions OPEN/HALF_OPEN/CLOSED based on configuration, and raises when breaker open.
concerns: call() re-raises raw exception without additional context; callers must add diagnostics separately.
opportunities: Emit analytics events on state transitions to observe breaker activity in production.
nodes.notes: Used by decorators and ErrorRecoveryManager to protect external services.

nodes.name: CircuitBreakerConfig
nodes.summary: Dataclass holding circuit breaker thresholds, recovery timeout, and success requirement tuning.
nodes.mechanism: Stores failure threshold, recovery cooldown, success threshold, and request timeout consumed by CircuitBreaker and presets.
concerns: Timeout attribute unused by current call wrapper; risk of drift between config and behavior.
opportunities: Enforce type validation or integrate timeout field with timeout_protection to honor configuration.
nodes.notes: Default configs instantiated for API, session, and database breaker presets.

nodes.name: CircuitBreakerOpenError
nodes.summary: Exception raised when circuit breaker is open.

nodes.name: CircuitState
nodes.summary: Circuit breaker states.

nodes.name: ConfigurationError
nodes.summary: Exception for configuration errors.

nodes.name: DataValidationError
nodes.summary: Exception for data validation errors.

nodes.name: DatabaseConnectionError
nodes.summary: Exception for database connection errors.

nodes.name: DatabaseError
nodes.summary: Database-related errors.

nodes.name: DatabaseErrorHandler
nodes.summary: Handler for database-related errors.

nodes.name: EnhancedErrorRecovery
nodes.summary: Manages retry statistics and circuit breaker state for operations using enhanced recovery wrappers.
nodes.mechanism: Maintains per-operation counters, success/failure tracking, and circuit breaker timers to throttle repeated failures.
concerns: Stats dictionary grows without pruning; long-running processes could accumulate stale operation keys.
opportunities: Add reset/prune API so long-lived sessions can clear obsolete stats.
nodes.notes: Global instance exported as error_recovery for module consumers.

nodes.name: ErrorCategory
nodes.summary: Error categories for classification.

nodes.name: ErrorContext
nodes.summary: Dataclass capturing retry attempt metadata, error history, and strategy configuration.
nodes.mechanism: Tracks attempt counts, computes exponential backoff delay with jitter, and stores partial results for fallback handlers.
concerns: Context growth with partial results or error history could impact memory for very long retries.
opportunities: Expose serialization helper to persist context when long operations span process restarts.
nodes.notes: Instances created by with_enhanced_recovery decorator to orchestrate retries.

nodes.name: ErrorHandler
nodes.summary: Abstract base class for error handlers.

nodes.name: ErrorHandlerRegistry
nodes.summary: Maintains handler list and dispatches exceptions to database/network/browser adapters before falling back to AppError.
nodes.mechanism: Registers default handlers, iterates to find capable handler, catches handler failures, and provides fallback AppError conversion.
concerns: Handler detection relies on keyword heuristics which may misclassify errors.
opportunities: Introduce structured mapping by exception type to reduce reliance on string contains checks.
nodes.notes: Backs global handle_error() helper via module-level singleton.

nodes.name: ErrorRecoveryManager
nodes.summary: Coordinates circuit breakers and registered recovery strategies across services.
nodes.mechanism: Caches CircuitBreaker instances by name, stores recovery callbacks, exposes health status, and can reset breakers.
concerns: Recovery strategies currently placeholders; unclear how consumers should supply implementations.
opportunities: Integrate with session manager to trigger actual browser/API recovery routines when breakers trip.
nodes.notes: Singleton error_recovery_manager exports this for decorators and health reporting.

nodes.name: ErrorSeverity
nodes.summary: Enum categorizing error gravity levels from low to critical.
nodes.mechanism: Provides four severity designations used for messaging or future policy decisions.
concerns: Currently unused outside module tests; risk of drift if not referenced elsewhere.
opportunities: Integrate with logging or telemetry payloads to standardize severity reporting.
nodes.notes: Enum values align with structured logging taxonomy used in ops dashboards.

nodes.name: FatalError
nodes.summary: Exception that indicates the operation should not be retried.

nodes.name: MaxApiFailuresExceededError
nodes.summary: Exception for exceeding maximum API failures.

nodes.name: MissingConfigError
nodes.summary: Exception for missing configuration errors.

nodes.name: NetworkError
nodes.summary: Network-related errors.

nodes.name: NetworkErrorHandler
nodes.summary: Handler for network-related errors.

nodes.name: NetworkTimeoutError
nodes.summary: Exception for network timeout errors.

nodes.name: RecoveryContext
nodes.summary: Context container shared across enhanced recovery attempts.

nodes.name: RecoveryStrategy
nodes.summary: Enum describing available recovery patterns such as retries, backoff, and circuit breaker.
nodes.mechanism: Enumerates strategy names consumed by ErrorContext and decorator logic to select behavior.
concerns: Strategy enum values beyond EXPONENTIAL_BACKOFF are not fully leveraged yet.
opportunities: Implement circuit breaker and graceful degradation branches to honor enum intent.
nodes.notes: Supports future expansion toward per-operation policy configuration.

nodes.name: RetryConfig

nodes.mechanism: Captures attempt limits, delay parameters, jitter, and stop/retry exception lists consumed by decorator logic.
concerns: RetryConfig instances seldom used directly; keep in sync with retry_on_failure defaults.
opportunities: Allow serialization into config files so runtime can adjust retry policy without code changes.
nodes.notes: Paired with RetryStrategy enum though most code paths rely on decorator parameters.

nodes.name: APICallWatchdog
nodes.summary: Timeout watchdog guarding API calls with forced session restart callbacks.
nodes.mechanism: Maintains timer-backed callbacks to trigger emergency restarts when API calls exceed configured duration; supports context manager usage.
concerns: Relies on threading.Timer which may delay shutdown in heavy load scenarios.
opportunities: Evaluate integrating with asyncio loop or analytics event logging for timeout frequency.
nodes.notes: Added after 7-hour hang incident; multiple regression tests cover edge cases.

nodes.name: SessionLifecycleState

nodes.name: SessionManager
nodes.summary: Central coordinator for browser, database, and API resources with cached component managers.
nodes.mechanism: Reuses cached DatabaseManager, BrowserManager, APIManager, and SessionValidator instances; exposes readiness, health monitoring, and rate limiting orchestration.
concerns: Complexity high; multiple responsibilities including cookie sync and health monitoring in single class.
Error-handling branches span browser/API/DB recovery making test coverage difficult.
opportunities: Evaluate splitting cookie management and health monitoring into dedicated helpers once review finishes.
Document watchdog integration and cascade safeguards in README architecture section.
nodes.notes: Full review complete through watchdog helpers; capture recovery patterns and cached identifier logic.

nodes.name: SessionValidator
nodes.summary: Encapsulates readiness workflow composed of login, navigation, cookie, and CSRF validation steps.
nodes.mechanism: Maintains timestamp for JS error sweep, exposes perform_readiness_checks with retry loop, and offers helper methods for cookie validation plus login verification.
concerns: Coupling to BrowserManager/APIManager/SessionManager is implicit through duck-typed arguments, complicating type checking.
Retry loop only sleeps 5s regardless of failure reason, which can waste time on fatal conditions.
opportunities: Annotate parameters with Protocols to clarify required interface methods for injected managers.
Surface per-attempt diagnostics object so callers can escalate when specific stages fail repeatedly.
nodes.notes: Constructed without dependencies; relies on injected managers at call time.

nodes.name: PerformanceMetricsConfig
nodes.summary: Dataclass for passing aggregated metrics into _print_performance_metrics.
nodes.mechanism: Bundles collected TestExecutionMetrics, totals, pass/fail counts, and flag state controlling output and persistence.
opportunities: Add optional percentile thresholds to target problematic modules.
nodes.notes: Assembled in main when monitoring is enabled.

nodes.name: PerformanceMonitor
nodes.summary: Threaded sampler capturing psutil memory and CPU usage during test execution.
nodes.mechanism: Spawns background thread polling psutil.Process metrics every 100ms, aggregates average/peak usage, and exposes start/stop lifecycle methods.
concerns: Polling strategy increases overhead on very short tests.
opportunities: Consider adaptive sampling or integration with psutil oneshot APIs.
nodes.notes: Used by run_module_tests when monitoring enabled.

nodes.name: TestExecutionConfig
nodes.summary: Dataclass packaging execution parameters for _execute_tests.
nodes.mechanism: Holds discovered modules, description mapping, monitoring toggles, and concurrency flags for downstream helpers.
opportunities: Expose per-module overrides to tune instrumentation cost.
nodes.notes: Constructed within main before invoking _execute_tests.

nodes.name: TestExecutionMetrics
nodes.summary: Dataclass capturing per-module execution timing, resource, and quality data.
nodes.mechanism: Stores module name, duration, success flag, test counts, resource usage, timestamps, optional error text, and embedded QualityMetrics.
opportunities: Consider persisting additional percentiles for richer analytics.
nodes.notes: Populated by _create_test_metrics based on subprocess results.

nodes.name: TestResultCache
nodes.summary: RESERVED: Utility class persisting prior test outcomes to skip unchanged modules.
nodes.mechanism: Reads/writes JSON cache keyed by module, tracks MD5 file hashes, and exposes helpers for deciding if a module can be skipped.
concerns: Hash lookup assumes modules live alongside runner and may miss nested paths.
opportunities: Integrate with optimize_test_order to avoid re-running fast clean modules.
nodes.notes: RESERVED FOR FUTURE DEVELOPMENT: Test Infrastructure Todo #18 placeholder; fully implemented and tested but not yet wired into execution path. Will enable incremental testing by skipping unchanged modules.

nodes.name: TestSuitePerformance
nodes.summary: Dataclass tracking aggregate suite metrics for benchmark runs.
nodes.mechanism: Captures totals for duration, tests, pass/fail counts, averaged resource usage, computed parallel efficiency, and optimization suggestions list.
opportunities: Augment with percentile latency data for slowest modules.
nodes.notes: Persisted to test_performance_metrics.json when benchmarking enabled.

nodes.mechanism: Parses arguments, loads .env secrets, normalizes provider base URLs, pings Moonshot/DeepSeek/Gemini/Local LLM endpoints, and renders TestResult summaries with truncated-response detection.
concerns: Relies on optional SDKs (openai, google-generativeai, dotenv); missing imports degrade functionality silently.
Stores provider errors as plain text without structured telemetry, limiting automated regression tracking.
opportunities: Add JSON output mode so CI can record provider health trends.
Share base URL normalization with ai_interface to avoid drift between test and production code.
nodes.notes: Run via `python ai_api_test.py --provider gemini` to sanity-check credentials before Action 7 deployments.

nodes.name: __main__.py
nodes.summary: Thin entry point so `python -m config` prints package info instead of failing.
nodes.mechanism: Normalizes sys.path for legacy imports, then under __main__ prints version/instructions about config_manager/config_schema availability; no runtime side effects beyond stdout messaging.
concerns: Path mutation duplicates logic from __init__, implying both files must stay in sync.
opportunities: Share a helper for path bootstrapping to avoid drift and consolidate future changes.
Extend with a quick diagnostic that verifies config files exist when run directly.
nodes.notes: Convenience wrapper mainly for developers validating configuration packaging.

nodes.name: config_manager.py
nodes.summary: RESERVED: Central configuration loader that hydrates ConfigSchema from defaults, files, and environment with safety clamps.
nodes.mechanism: ConfigManager orchestrates .env loading, merges JSON/YAML/TOML files with environment overrides, builds ConfigSchema via from_dict, enforces sequential API rate limits (_enforce_api_safety_constraints), and caches results with hot-reload helpers; exposes ValidationError for callers.
concerns: File spans 1.5k lines with duplicated setup_module/path bootstrapping, increasing risk of import-order bugs and making review difficult.
Hot reload relies on file mtimes but lacks watcher integration, so long-running sessions may keep stale config without explicit refresh.
opportunities: Extract API safety enforcement and file format loaders into submodules to shrink ConfigManager surface area and break cycles.
Add proactive telemetry when unsafe settings are requested so operations can track override usage.
nodes.notes: RESERVED FOR FUTURE DEVELOPMENT: 11+ methods fully implemented including load_from_file(), merge_config(), validate_schema(), get_safe_defaults(), reload_config(), watch_for_changes(), _enforce_api_safety_constraints(), export_config(), get_validation_report(). Used by config package __init__ to expose `config_schema`; action modules depend on its rate-limit enforcement for production safety.

nodes.name: config_schema.py
nodes.summary: Type-safe dataclass schemas and validators backing the project's configuration surface.
nodes.mechanism: Defines ConfigSchema plus nested DatabaseConfig, APIConfig, CacheConfig, SeleniumConfig, LoggingConfig, SecurityConfig, etc., each with __post_init__ checks using ConfigValidator/ValidationRule helpers, normalizes paths, and enforces environment-specific safety rules.
concerns: Validation happens during dataclass construction, so tests that partially build configs hit exceptions before they can patch fields.
1.4k line module duplicates validator scaffolding and makes it hard to track which fields are actually used.
opportunities: Adopt declarative schema tooling (e.g., pydantic) or codegen to collapse boilerplate and emit docs automatically.
Publish schema version/hash so long-running sessions can detect drift and trigger safe reloads.
nodes.notes: Instantiated by ConfigManager.from_dict; informs rate-limiter defaults and Selenium settings consumed by SessionManager.

nodes.name: validator.py
nodes.summary: Unified Configuration Validation Layer.

nodes.name: __main__.py
nodes.summary: Executable harness that verifies core package components import cleanly when run as a module.
nodes.mechanism: Bootstraps sys.path, defines tests that import key core modules and check filesystem presence, then wraps them in run_comprehensive_tests for `python -m core`; emits a summary banner on success.
concerns: Filesystem assertions assume monolithic .py files; refactors to packages would require updating checks.
opportunities: Extend the CLI output with diagnostic info (e.g., config location) to aid onboarding.
Reuse tests in CI to ensure __all__ exports remain intact after refactors.
nodes.notes: Primarily a smoke test entry point; retains legacy path shim similar to config/__main__.

nodes.name: api_manager.py
nodes.summary: Encapsulates Ancestry API session handling, identifier retrieval, and cookie synchronization for downstream clients.
nodes.mechanism: Maintains a configured requests.Session with pooled adapters, syncs cookies from BrowserManager, fetches CSRF/profile/tree identifiers, and performs guarded API requests with retry-aware helpers.
concerns: Cookie synchronization still hinges on a live Selenium driver and cloudscraper availability, complicating recovery paths.
Identifier caching and logging guards are scattered, making state resets easy to overlook during error handling.
opportunities: Centralize response typing and telemetry so action modules can share richer diagnostics.
Add explicit invalidation hooks when cookies expire to avoid silent stale sessions.
nodes.notes: SessionManager caches APIManager instances for all action modules.

nodes.name: approval_queue.py
nodes.summary: Human-in-the-Loop Approval Queue System

nodes.name: browser_manager.py
nodes.summary: Controls Selenium WebDriver lifecycle, navigation, and cookie access for session-dependent workflows.
nodes.mechanism: Creates Chrome drivers per configuration, tracks driver_live/browser_needed flags, ensures login readiness, fetches cookies with bounded waits, and exposes navigation helpers plus screenshot/debug utilities.
concerns: Heavy reliance on global config and live ChromeDriver instances forces extensive mocking in tests.
Timeout tuning is scattered across methods, increasing risk of flakes on slow environments.
opportunities: Extract driver configuration and launch options into a dedicated builder with headless toggles.
Instrument navigation and login timings so health monitors can react to slowdowns.
nodes.notes: SessionManager.browser_manager delegates nearly all UI automation through this module.

nodes.name: cancellation.py
nodes.summary: Cooperative cancellation flag for long-running actions and background loops.
nodes.mechanism: Wraps a module-level threading.Event inside _CancellationState, exposes request_cancel/clear_cancel/is_cancel_requested helpers, tracks optional scope strings for diagnostics, and provides tests ensuring thread visibility.
concerns: Global state must be cleared between runs; forgetting to call clear_cancel can leak prior scopes.
opportunities: Log cancellation requests (scope + timestamp) to analytics so operators know why runs stopped.
Offer context manager helper to auto-clear scope after scoped operations.
nodes.notes: SessionManager and action loops poll is_cancel_requested to exit gracefully during shutdown.

nodes.name: database_manager.py
nodes.summary: Provides SQLAlchemy engine/session setup, connection pooling, and telemetry for the ancestry SQLite datastore.
nodes.mechanism: Resolves database path from ConfigManager, builds engines with adaptive pool sizing, tracks connection and query stats, exposes session and batch contexts, and offers backup/maintenance helpers.
concerns: Combines pooling heuristics, telemetry, CLI helpers, and tests in one module, leaving a broad maintenance surface.
Adaptive pooling counters reset per process, so tuning decisions lack historical context.
opportunities: Split performance monitoring into a dedicated analytics helper consumed by SessionManager.
Add integration coverage for migrations and backup workflows against real SQLite files.
nodes.notes: SessionManager caches DatabaseManager instances and shares them across actions.

nodes.name: dependency_injection.py
nodes.summary: Provides DI container, decorators, and scopes to wire core services while avoiding circular imports.
nodes.mechanism: Supplies DIContainer for singleton/transient/factory registration, inject decorator for constructor wiring, configure_dependencies bootstrapper, and thread-safe resolution with scope tracking for tests.
concerns: Container is effectively global; forgetting to reset between tests can leak mocks and singletons.
Configuration bootstrap still relies on manual registration order, leaving circular dependencies easy to reintroduce.
opportunities: Add context manager to temporarily override bindings during action-specific operations.
Generate dependency graphs to detect cycles or missing registrations automatically.
nodes.notes: Action modules primarily resolve SessionManager directly today; DI scaffolding enables future modularization.

nodes.name: error_handling.py
nodes.summary: RESERVED: Primary error framework supplying retry decorators, circuit breakers, and exception hierarchy for the platform.
nodes.mechanism: Defines CircuitBreaker with configurable thresholds, RetryConfig-driven retry_on_failure decorator, graceful_degradation wrappers, error_context logging, and central handler registry used across actions and SessionManager.
concerns: Module spans 1.4k lines with overlapping features; coupling makes it hard to adopt lighter-weight error utilities.
Retry decorators default to catching broad Exception, so caller must pass stop_on types to avoid masking programming errors.
opportunities: Integrate enhanced error recovery telemetry into the existing handler registry for unified reporting.
Document common decorator profiles (API, DB, UI) to guide consistent usage across actions.
nodes.notes: RESERVED FOR FUTURE DEVELOPMENT: 10+ functions fully implemented including @retry_on_failure, @graceful_degradation, @error_context, CircuitBreaker class, ErrorCategory enum, ErrorSeverity enum, handle_error(), register_error_handler(), AncestryException hierarchy. SessionManager decorators such as retry_on_failure and graceful_degradation originate here.

nodes.name: logging_utils.py
nodes.summary: Shared logging helpers that bootstrap logging_config, prevent duplicate handlers, and offer lazy debug hooks.
nodes.mechanism: get_logger bootstraps logging_config.setup_logging once, ensure_no_duplicate_handlers cleans handler stacks, suppress_external_loggers tunes third-party noise, and OptimizedLogger/debug_if_enabled gate expensive debug formatting.
concerns: Implicit import of logging_config during get_logger can trigger circular imports if called too early in startup.
Global setup flag is module-scoped; concurrent initialization in multi-process scenarios may still double attach handlers.
opportunities: Expose context manager to temporarily raise verbosity when debugging a specific action.
Emit metrics on suppressed external loggers to ensure important warnings are not hidden.
nodes.notes: standard_imports.setup_module delegates logger creation to get_logger for every module import.

nodes.name: progress_indicators.py
nodes.summary: Provides tqdm-backed progress bars with ETA, memory, and cache metrics for long-running automation actions.
nodes.mechanism: ProgressIndicator wraps tqdm and threadsafe stats tracking, pulling config from common_params, updating rate/memory/ETA display via update() and with_progress context helpers while logging lifecycle events.
concerns: Depends on psutil/tqdm being installed; missing packages surface as runtime errors when actions start.
Per-update locking plus frequent memory sampling can add overhead when update_interval is too small.
opportunities: Emit structured progress snapshots so analytics dashboard can mirror CLI progress.
Allow pluggable formatters for headless environments that prefer log-only output.
nodes.notes: Action 6, 7, and 9 use with_progress to show user-facing throughput and ETAs.

nodes.name: registry_utils.py
nodes.summary: Auto-registers module callables into a shared registry to cut repetitive boilerplate and track availability.
nodes.mechanism: SmartFunctionRegistry scans globals with include/exclude patterns, deduplicates entries, stores stats, and offers helpers like auto_register_module, performance_register, and create_registration_report used by test suites.
concerns: Pattern-based filtering may accidentally register helper lambdas or miss new naming conventions.
Global smart_registry persists between tests, so state must be cleared to avoid cross-module leakage.
opportunities: Add namespace scoping so multiple registries can coexist for different subsystems.
Surface registry stats in diagnostics to confirm critical test hooks remain registered.
nodes.notes: Standard import helper auto_register_module(globals(), __name__) uses this to collect test entrypoints.

nodes.name: session_cache.py
nodes.summary: Caches expensive SessionManager components to slash startup time and reuse browser/API/database state safely.
nodes.mechanism: Hash-es configuration to key cached DatabaseManager/BrowserManager/APIManager instances, wraps constructors with @cached_session_component, tracks TTLs, and exposes stats/clear hooks layered on cache.BaseCacheModule. Provides decorator aliases (memoize_with_refresh, cache_property_result, typed_cache, method_cache) that point to the main cached_session_component decorator for backward compatibility.
concerns: Weak global cache invalidation means stale Selenium drivers or DB engines can linger between runs if TTLs mis-tuned.
Directly imports ConfigManager during hashing, so early use before config bootstraps can raise subtle errors.
opportunities: Expose deterministic teardown utilities so test suites can reset shared state explicitly.
Record cache hit ratios to telemetry to justify further TTL tuning.
nodes.notes: SessionManager relies on cached_* helpers for performance; clearing caches is required in integration tests. NOTE: 2025-11-24 consolidated 4 duplicate decorator implementations (memoize_with_refresh, cache_property_result, typed_cache, method_cache) into aliases pointing to the main cached_session_component decorator.

nodes.name: session_guards.py
nodes.summary: Module session_guards.py

nodes.name: session_manager.py
nodes.summary: Primary orchestrator coordinating cached database, browser, and API managers plus rate-limited session workflows.
nodes.mechanism: Builds cached DatabaseManager, BrowserManager, APIManager, and SessionValidator instances, exposes ensure_* readiness guards, manages global rate limiter, and runs proactive health monitoring with analytics hooks.
concerns: Nearly 3k-line class interleaves caching, health monitoring, and CLI/test harness logic, so changes are hard to reason about.
Shared cached managers introduce hidden global state; tests must clear caches to avoid cross-suite contamination.
opportunities: Factor health monitoring and login recovery flows into composable helpers.
Expose a slimmer public interface focused on readiness checks for easier mocking in action modules.
nodes.notes: SessionManager underpins exec_actn and relies on core.session_cache plus utils.RateLimiter.

nodes.name: session_mixins.py
nodes.summary: Mixins for SessionManager to reduce class size and complexity.

nodes.name: session_utils.py
nodes.summary: session_utils.py - Global Session Management with Dependency Injection

nodes.name: session_validator.py
nodes.summary: Enforces login, cookie, URL, and CSRF readiness checks before actions execute against the Ancestry session.
nodes.mechanism: Coordinates BrowserManager and APIManager to verify login state, sync cookies to requests, validate CSRF tokens, and retry with graceful handling of WebDriver exceptions and action-specific skip rules.
concerns: Relies on live Selenium state, so unit tests need extensive mocking to simulate cookie and login flows.
Skip lists for cookie checks are duplicated with action metadata in main.exec_actn, risking divergence.
opportunities: Expose structured readiness results for analytics instead of boolean flags.
Coalesce skip-check logic into shared configuration consumed by main and SessionValidator.
nodes.notes: SessionManager.ensure_session_ready delegates validation here before running actions.

nodes.name: system_cache.py
nodes.summary: System-wide cache layer providing API, database, and memory optimization utilities for long-running actions.
nodes.mechanism: Builds APIResponseCache and DatabaseQueryCache atop cache.BaseCacheModule, decorates functions with cached_api_call/cached_database_query/memory_optimized, orchestrates warm_system_caches and telemetry via get_system_cache_stats.
concerns: Decorators can mask upstream retry/backoff logic if applied indiscriminately to mutable responses.
Memory optimizer toggles GC thresholds globally, which may interact poorly with concurrent processes.
opportunities: Add granular cache invalidation hooks so action modules can clear per-service entries after failures.
Surface cache hit/miss metrics to analytics dashboard for production observability.
nodes.notes: Integrated with cache_manager.cached_api_call and invoked by main.initialize_aggressive_caching.

nodes.name: core.error_handling.circuit_breaker
nodes.summary: Decorator adding per-function circuit breaker protection using module-level manager.
nodes.mechanism: Creates CircuitBreakerConfig, retrieves breaker from ErrorRecoveryManager, and delegates call through breaker state machine.
concerns: Shares breaker per function name; collisions possible if multiple functions share identifier.
opportunities: Support namespacing parameter to avoid collisions and ease telemetry filtering.
nodes.notes: Used selectively for high-risk external integrations.

nodes.name: core.error_handling.create_user_guidance
nodes.summary: Builds default mapping of exception types to user-facing remediation tips.
nodes.mechanism: Returns dictionary for common IO, permission, and configuration failures consumed by retry decorators.
concerns: Guidance text duplicates emoji-rich logging style; may need localization strategy later.
opportunities: Externalize guidance content to configuration for easier updates.
nodes.notes: Helps provide actionable hints during retry logging.

nodes.name: core.error_handling.error_context
nodes.summary: Decorator annotating AppError context dictionaries with supplied metadata label/value pairs.
nodes.mechanism: On exception, checks for AppError, merges context data, and re-raises to caller.
concerns: Non-AppError exceptions pass through unchanged; ensure upstream converts to AppError when needed.
opportunities: Allow callback hook to transform non-AppError exceptions before propagation.
nodes.notes: Used across actions to tag telemetry with operation names.

nodes.name: core.error_handling.error_handler
nodes.summary: Decorator factory that converts exceptions to AppError via registry, logs based on severity, and optionally re-raises.
nodes.mechanism: Builds wrapper capturing function metadata, invokes handle_error on exceptions, logs at severity-driven level, and re-raises when requested.
concerns: Logging uses global logger; ensure caller modules configure handlers to avoid duplicate output.
opportunities: Add configuration to emit structured JSON logs for automated parsing.
nodes.notes: Applies on high-level workflows needing automated error conversion.

nodes.name: core.error_handling.error_handling_module_tests
nodes.summary: Core Error Handling module test suite.

nodes.name: core.error_handling.execute_safely
nodes.summary: Safely execute a function with error handling (Function Wrapper).

nodes.name: core.error_handling.get_error_handler
nodes.summary: Get the appropriate error handler for a specific exception type.

nodes.name: core.error_handling.graceful_degradation
nodes.summary: Decorator returning fallback value or callable when wrapped function raises an exception.
nodes.mechanism: Catches exceptions, logs warning, and either invokes fallback_func or returns static fallback value.
concerns: Fallback function executed with same args as original; ensure idempotency to avoid side effects.
opportunities: Emit telemetry when fallback path triggered to surface degradation frequency.
nodes.notes: Often paired with timeout_protection for long-running orchestration flows.

nodes.name: core.error_handling.handle_error
nodes.summary: Global helper routing exceptions through ErrorHandlerRegistry to produce AppError instances.
nodes.mechanism: Delegates to registry singleton, returning AppError when provided error type matches specialized handler or fallback path.
concerns: Relies on global registry state; thread-safety assumptions hinge on handler implementations.
opportunities: Expose async variant or contextvar-based registry override for tests.
nodes.notes: Used by safe_execute and ErrorContext to standardize failures.

nodes.name: core.error_handling.handle_partial_success
nodes.summary: Default partial success handler returning accumulated results or re-raising error.
nodes.mechanism: If partial results exist, logs warning and returns them; otherwise propagates original exception.
concerns: Function only used internally; callers needing custom logic must pass handler into decorator.
opportunities: Extend to include metadata about incomplete work for post-processing.
nodes.notes: Invoked by _handle_partial_success when recovery falls back to partial completion.

nodes.name: core.error_handling.register_error_handler
nodes.summary: Register a custom error handler globally.

nodes.name: core.error_handling.resolve_retry_policy
nodes.summary: Return resolved RetryPolicyProfile for retry decorators.

nodes.name: core.error_handling.retry_on_failure
nodes.summary: Decorator factory wrapping functions with retry/backoff logic and stop conditions.
nodes.mechanism: Iterates attempts, checks stop/retry exception filters, applies exponential backoff with optional jitter, re-raises last error on exhaustion.
concerns: Sleeps inside decorator; long-running retries may block event loops if misused.
opportunities: Expose async version or integrate with EnhancedErrorRecovery to unify retry reporting.
nodes.notes: Applied to SessionManager identifier fetchers and multiple action workflows.

nodes.name: core.error_handling.safe_execute
nodes.summary: Executes callable with blanket exception handling, logging, and fallback return value.
nodes.mechanism: Wraps function call in try/except, converts exception via handle_error, logs warning, and returns default value when failure occurs.
concerns: Suppresses exceptions silently unless default return inspected; ensure callers monitor logs.
opportunities: Allow optional callback hook to observe AppError objects for telemetry.
nodes.notes: Legacy compatibility helper still used in background maintenance scripts.

nodes.name: core.error_handling.selenium_retry
nodes.summary: Telemetry-derived retry helper for Selenium/browser operations.

nodes.name: core.error_handling.test_circuit_breaker
nodes.summary: Validate that CircuitBreaker transitions through OPEN → HALF_OPEN → CLOSED.

nodes.name: core.error_handling.test_error_context
nodes.summary: Ensure ErrorContext reports failures through handle_error and preserves context.

nodes.name: core.error_handling.test_error_handling
nodes.summary: Exercise safe_execute and handle_error behavior end-to-end.

nodes.name: core.error_handling.test_error_recovery
nodes.summary: Exercise ErrorRecoveryManager circuit breaker orchestration.

nodes.name: core.error_handling.test_error_types
nodes.summary: Validate specialized AncestryError subclasses capture metadata.

nodes.name: core.error_handling.test_recovery_decorator_behavior
nodes.summary: Ensure with_recovery delegates to fallback logic after failures.

nodes.name: core.error_handling.timeout_protection
nodes.summary: Cross-platform timeout decorator supporting Windows thread join fallback and Unix signals.
nodes.mechanism: Wraps callable execution, launching thread join on Windows or SIGALRM on Unix, raising TimeoutError when duration exceeded.
concerns: Thread-based timeout leaves worker thread alive post-timeout; repeated timeouts could accumulate stray threads.
opportunities: Explore multiprocessing or cooperative cancellation to prevent orphaned threads on Windows.
nodes.notes: Decorates long-running actions like DNA match gather and message processing.

nodes.name: core.error_handling.with_api_recovery
nodes.summary: Convenience decorator preset tuned for API IO with higher attempt counts and network exceptions.
nodes.mechanism: Calls with_enhanced_recovery with API-specific retry parameters and default user guidance mapping.
concerns: Static retryable exception list may miss library-specific network errors.
opportunities: Allow config overrides so rate limiting studies can adjust max_attempts/backoff without code edits.
nodes.notes: Adopted by inbox and messaging actions to harden API calls.

nodes.name: core.error_handling.with_circuit_breaker
nodes.summary: Decorator binding functions to named circuit breakers managed by ErrorRecoveryManager.
nodes.mechanism: Retrieves breaker for service_name and routes calls through CircuitBreaker.call for stateful protection.
concerns: No auto-registration of recovery strategies; service_name must be coordinated externally.
opportunities: Augment to automatically register default recovery strategy when absent.
nodes.notes: Used for fine-grained breaker control beyond simple function-name binding.

nodes.name: core.error_handling.with_database_recovery
nodes.summary: Decorator preset for database operations with modest backoff and connection-focused exceptions.
nodes.mechanism: Delegates to with_enhanced_recovery using ConnectionError/TimeoutError handling and shared guidance text.
concerns: TimeoutError may not surface for SQLite interactions; coverage limited to networked DBs.
opportunities: Integrate with DatabaseManager metrics to adjust behavior based on pool health.
nodes.notes: Currently unused but available for future DB resilience needs.

nodes.name: core.error_handling.with_enhanced_recovery
nodes.summary: Decorator factory applying retries with backoff, circuit checks, and optional partial success handling.
nodes.mechanism: Builds wrapper using ErrorContext, consults EnhancedErrorRecovery for circuit status, logs attempts, sleeps based on jittered backoff, and delegates to optional handlers.
concerns: Wrapper captures broad Exception by default; callers must supply narrower retryable_exceptions for safety.
opportunities: Expose async-compatible variant to avoid blocking sleep in coroutine contexts.
nodes.notes: Used across action modules to shield API and messaging workflows.

nodes.name: core.error_handling.with_file_recovery
nodes.summary: Decorator preset guarding file IO against transient permission/path issues.
nodes.mechanism: Invokes with_enhanced_recovery with file-centric exceptions and shorter delays for quick retries.
concerns: May mask persistent permission issues if max_attempts left at default.
opportunities: Hook into partial success handler to return successfully processed files in batch jobs.
nodes.notes: Intended for backup/restore workflows interacting with local filesystem.

nodes.name: core.error_handling.with_recovery
nodes.summary: Decorator invoking caller-supplied recovery strategy when wrapped function raises an exception.
nodes.mechanism: On failure logs warning and calls recovery_strategy with original args/kwargs before returning its result.
concerns: Recovery strategy receives same arguments as failing function; must be resilient to original error context.
opportunities: Allow recovery strategy to receive raised exception for richer handling decisions.
nodes.notes: Scaffold for custom remediation steps in action modules.

nodes.name: main._assign_action_registry_functions
nodes.summary: Attach callable implementations to action registry metadata.

nodes.name: main._check_action_confirmation
nodes.summary: Prompts the user for confirmation before executing destructive database operations.
nodes.mechanism: Looks up the selected action in a warning map, prompts for yes/no, and returns False when the user declines to continue.
concerns: Relies on blocking stdin input, which can impede scripted automation.
opportunities: Allow command-line flags or environment variables to pre-approve destructive operations.
nodes.notes: Executed inside the main menu loop before dispatching the selected action.

nodes.name: main._create_config_manager
nodes.summary: Instantiate ConfigManager if available.

nodes.name: main._dispatch_menu_action
nodes.summary: Central dispatcher translating menu selections into database, browser, test, or meta handlers.
nodes.mechanism: Evaluates the choice against database actions, browser actions, test options, and meta commands in order, delegating to the respective helper and returning a boolean to continue or exit the loop.
concerns: Returns True even when delegated action fails, leaving the operator reliant on logs for status.
opportunities: Propagate action success results to enable uniform success/error messaging.
nodes.notes: Main loop uses the return value to determine whether to keep prompting the operator.

nodes.name: main._execute_meta_action
nodes.summary: Execute a meta action and return loop control signal.

nodes.name: main._execute_primary_action
nodes.summary: Execute a primary action (non-meta/test) using exec_actn.

nodes.name: main._execute_test_action
nodes.summary: Execute a registered test action.

nodes.name: main._parse_start_page_argument
nodes.summary: Parse optional start page for Action 6.

nodes.name: main._run_research_tools
nodes.summary: Run the interactive research tools menu.

nodes.name: main._test_action_integration
nodes.summary: Verifies that primary action entry points remain callable from the main module.
nodes.mechanism: Iterates over the key action functions imported at module load, asserting they are callable and non-null.
concerns: Only checks callable presence; deeper behavioral regressions require action-specific suites.
opportunities: Expand to invoke lightweight dry-run routines once deterministic mocks are available.
nodes.notes: Catches regressions where imports are removed or renamed.

nodes.name: main._test_cleanup_procedures
nodes.summary: Checks that cleanup logic remains present in main()'s finally block.
nodes.mechanism: Examines the source of main() to ensure cleanup terminology and finally blocks remain intact.
concerns: Relies on textual heuristics rather than asserting specific cleanup calls.
opportunities: Assert that _cleanup_session_manager is invoked to tighten the guarantee.
nodes.notes: Complements _test_error_handling_structure for exit hygiene.

nodes.name: main._test_clear_log_file_function
nodes.summary: Verifies that clear_log_file returns a well-formed tuple and handles failures gracefully.
nodes.mechanism: Invokes clear_log_file, asserts return structure, and tolerates exceptions by confirming they are standard Exception instances.
concerns: Touches the real log file path, so concurrent runs could race on filesystem state.
opportunities: Mock filesystem interactions to isolate the test from environment-specific paths.
nodes.notes: Part of the main module regression suite.

nodes.name: main._test_edge_case_handling
nodes.summary: Ensures critical action modules remain imported for edge-case handling coverage.
nodes.mechanism: Inspects sys.modules for action6-10 entries and asserts they are available during main module execution.
concerns: Does not validate lazy imports inside run_gedcom_then_api_fallback beyond module presence.
opportunities: Add targeted import tests for lazily loaded helpers referenced in Action 10.
nodes.notes: Captures regressions where refactors drop required imports.

nodes.name: main._test_error_handling_structure
nodes.summary: Confirms main() retains its defensive try/except/finally structure.
nodes.mechanism: Uses inspect.getsource to ensure the function source contains try, except, finally, and KeyboardInterrupt handlers.
concerns: String-based checks could miss structural issues if formatting changes break the pattern without removing keywords.
opportunities: Upgrade to AST-based analysis to verify the actual control-flow tree.
nodes.notes: Protects against refactors that accidentally drop cleanup or error handling.

nodes.name: main._test_exception_handling_coverage
nodes.summary: Ensures exception handling in main() covers generic errors and logs appropriately.
nodes.mechanism: Analyzes the source text of main() to confirm Exception clauses and logging references are present.
concerns: String scanning can give false positives if keywords appear in comments only.
opportunities: Adopt AST parsing to verify actual except blocks and logger calls.
nodes.notes: Guards against regressions that drop critical logging.

nodes.name: main._test_function_call_performance
nodes.summary: Ensures routine function calls remain performant within the CLI loop.
nodes.mechanism: Executes 1000 callable(menu) checks and asserts the total runtime stays below 100ms.
concerns: Time-based assertions can become brittle on slow developer laptops or CI containers.
opportunities: Replace hard-coded thresholds with percentile tracking fed by telemetry.
nodes.notes: Helps catch regressions that make the interactive loop sluggish.

nodes.name: main._test_import_error_handling
nodes.summary: Validates that the main module exposes essential imported symbols.
nodes.mechanism: Checks globals() for action orchestrators, configuration, and SessionManager references, raising assertion failures when absent.
concerns: Global lookups will pass even if modules are partially initialized or incompatible.
opportunities: Expand to import the modules directly to catch partially loaded states.
nodes.notes: Protects against accidental import regression in the entry module.

nodes.name: main._test_import_performance
nodes.summary: Guards against slow module reloads that could regress CLI startup times.
nodes.mechanism: Reloads cached modules such as config and asserts the elapsed wall time stays below one second.
concerns: Performance assertions can be flaky on heavily loaded CI agents.
opportunities: Collect and compare historical import timing to tune thresholds adaptively.
nodes.notes: Acts as a smoke alarm for runaway import costs.

nodes.name: main._test_main_function_structure
nodes.summary: Asserts that main() remains parameterless and callable for CLI entry point compatibility.
nodes.mechanism: Uses inspect.signature to confirm main takes no arguments while ensuring the symbol is callable.
concerns: Only inspects the signature; semantic regressions inside main() still depend on other tests.
opportunities: Extend to verify docstring or annotations once main() gains richer metadata.
nodes.notes: Guards against inadvertent API changes to the CLI entry point.

nodes.name: main._test_memory_efficiency
nodes.summary: Keeps module-level memory usage within guardrails after refactors.
nodes.mechanism: Uses sys.getsizeof and globals() length checks to enforce size limits on the main module object graph.
concerns: Crude thresholds may need adjustment as new helpers are added to main.py.
opportunities: Track historical globals counts to justify updated ceilings when new features land.
nodes.notes: Prevents accidental bloat from runaway global state.

nodes.name: main._test_reset_db_actn_integration
nodes.summary: Confirms reset_db_actn dependencies exist without mutating the database.
nodes.mechanism: Instantiates SessionManager, asserts required DatabaseManager attributes, and avoids executing the destructive reset logic.
concerns: Relies on real SessionManager construction which may open live resources during tests.
opportunities: Swap in lightweight fakes for SessionManager to reduce startup overhead.
nodes.notes: Integration safety net for the database reset action.

nodes.name: main._test_validate_action_config
nodes.summary: Exercises validate_action_config to confirm Action 6 rate-limit protections stay active.
nodes.mechanism: Calls validate_action_config, asserting a boolean return and tolerating exceptions that reference missing configuration.
concerns: Directly invokes production validation which may read the operator's real .env values during tests.
opportunities: Provide injectable config fixtures so tests can run in isolation from developer secrets.
nodes.notes: Ensures startup guardrails remain in place after Action 6 bug fixes.

nodes.name: main._validate_action_args
nodes.summary: Validate CLI arguments against action metadata.

nodes.name: main.main
nodes.summary: Top-level entry executing initialization, pre-authentication, and menu loop with graceful shutdown.
nodes.mechanism: Initializes application, preps services, loops on menu dispatch, handles confirmations, restores sleep, cleans resources on exit.
opportunities: Consider extracting menu loop into separate controller for testability.
nodes.notes: Ensures cleanup even on KeyboardInterrupt via finally block.

nodes.name: main.main_module_tests
nodes.summary: Aggregates main.py unit and integration checks using the shared TestSuite harness.
nodes.mechanism: Initializes a TestSuite, suppresses logging noise, and registers targeted tests covering configuration, integration, performance, and error handling before finishing the suite.
concerns: Relies on real imports and environment, so failures can stem from external state instead of code regressions.
opportunities: Parameterize the suite to allow focused subsets (e.g., skip performance tests on slow nodes).
nodes.notes: Entry point for the comprehensive main.py self-tests.

nodes.name: main.menu
nodes.summary: Renders the CLI menu, displays active log level, and returns the normalized user selection.
nodes.mechanism: Prints menu options, inspects console handler level when available, then reads stdin choice trimmed and lowercased for downstream dispatch.
concerns: Blocking input handling complicates automated testing or headless execution.
opportunities: Inject configurable IO adapter so tests and headless runs can supply menu choices.
nodes.notes: Used by the main loop each iteration to capture operator intent.

nodes.name: research.triangulation_intelligence._test_cluster_detection
nodes.summary: Test match clustering by surname.

nodes.name: research.triangulation_intelligence._test_confidence_level_calculation
nodes.summary: Test confidence level boundaries.

nodes.name: research.triangulation_intelligence._test_dna_evidence_analysis
nodes.summary: Test DNA evidence weight calculation.
