nodes.name: research.triangulation_intelligence.module_tests
nodes.summary: Run all module tests.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._analyze_test_output
nodes.summary: Interprets subprocess stdout/stderr to determine success and test counts.
nodes.mechanism: Combines output lines, checks return code, scans for failure markers, extracts textual test counts, and returns success flag plus numeric counts.
concerns: Parsing relies on emoji markers that could change with future formatting tweaks.
opportunities: Adopt structured output contract from module test framework to reduce heuristics.
nodes.notes: Results consumed by run_module_tests printing and metrics creation.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._build_test_command
nodes.summary: Constructs subprocess invocation and environment for a module test run.
nodes.mechanism: Builds python command with optional coverage flags, clones environment variables, and sets RUN_INTERNAL_TESTS for designated modules.
opportunities: Expose per-module timeout overrides alongside command construction.
nodes.notes: Used by _run_test_subprocess to materialize command list.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._calculate_performance_stats
nodes.summary: Calculate performance statistics from metrics.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._calculate_quality_distribution
nodes.summary: Calculate quality score distribution.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._categorize_violation
nodes.summary: Maps lint violation text to a coarse-grained category label.
nodes.mechanism: Scans violation strings for keywords such as 'too long', 'too complex', or 'missing type hint' and returns the corresponding category otherwise defaulting to 'Other'.
concerns: Keyword matching will drift if lint message wording changes.
opportunities: Share taxonomy with CodeQualityChecker to keep categories synchronized.
nodes.notes: Used by _print_quality_violations when grouping issues.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._check_cpu_usage
nodes.summary: Check for CPU-intensive tests and add suggestion if found.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._check_for_failures_in_output
nodes.summary: Post-processes stdout to confirm success flags and catch hidden failures.
nodes.mechanism: Splits output into lines and looks for failure indicators while ignoring benign 'Failed: 0' cases, flipping the success flag when evidence is found.
concerns: Indicator list must stay current with new failure message formats.
opportunities: Log which indicator triggered the failure for faster triage.
nodes.notes: Applied inside _analyze_test_output as a safety check.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._check_memory_usage
nodes.summary: Check for memory-intensive tests and add suggestion if found.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._check_parallel_execution
nodes.summary: Check if parallel execution would help and add suggestion if found.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._check_slow_tests
nodes.summary: Check for slow tests and add suggestion if found.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._clean_description_text
nodes.summary: Normalizes module description strings by trimming redundant prefixes.
nodes.mechanism: Strips punctuation, removes module name echoes, and ensures text starts with a meaningful phrase.
opportunities: Move cleanup heuristics into a reusable text utility if other tools need them.
nodes.notes: Supports _extract_first_meaningful_line.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._cleanup_browser_after_all_tests
nodes.summary: Close any browser session that was opened during test execution.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._count_enhanced_results
nodes.summary: Count enhanced modules that passed and failed.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._create_error_metrics
nodes.summary: Fabricates failure metrics when monitoring is enabled but subprocess crashes.
nodes.mechanism: Creates minimal TestExecutionMetrics with zero counts, timestamps, and captured error message for reporting consistency.
opportunities: Record exception types separately to aid failure triage.
nodes.notes: Used in run_module_tests error handler.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._create_test_metrics
nodes.summary: Wraps subprocess results into a TestExecutionMetrics instance.
nodes.mechanism: Receives module name, result dictionary, optional QualityMetrics, and returns populated dataclass with resource stats and error message extraction.
opportunities: Include per-module coverage data when coverage mode enabled.
nodes.notes: Called by run_module_tests after parsing output.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._discover_and_prepare_modules
nodes.summary: Discovers test modules and collects descriptions for reporting.
nodes.mechanism: Uses discovery helpers to list modules, deduplicates order, optimizes fast-mode sequencing, extracts docstring descriptions, and builds module-description tuples.
concerns: Docstring parsing is heuristic and may miss unconventional formats.
opportunities: Persist discovery cache to reduce repeated filesystem scans.
nodes.notes: Prints module counts and enhanced description coverage.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._ensure_venv
nodes.summary: Ensure running in venv, auto-restart if needed.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._execute_tests
nodes.summary: Executes test modules sequentially or in parallel while gathering metrics.
nodes.mechanism: Chooses between run_tests_parallel and sequential loop, tracks metrics, updates ordering history, and returns aggregated results with counts.
concerns: Sequential loop forces monitoring, which can add overhead to quick runs.
opportunities: Share execution logic between sequential and parallel paths to reduce drift.
nodes.notes: Central coordination point for execution strategy.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._execute_tests_with_timing
nodes.summary: Execute tests and measure runtime.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._extract_count_from_line
nodes.summary: Utility to parse numeric counts from lines containing a keyword.
nodes.mechanism: Strips ANSI codes, verifies the keyword is present, and slices the following token into an integer if possible.
opportunities: Return both integer and original substring for richer diagnostics.
nodes.notes: Shared by _find_passed_failed_counts.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._extract_docstring_end
nodes.summary: Collects docstring text that appears before closing triple quotes.
nodes.mechanism: Finds """ in the stripped line, grabs preceding content, appends it to the buffer, and tells the parser to stop.
opportunities: Handle inline closing quotes on the same line as opening to simplify logic elsewhere.
nodes.notes: Complement to _extract_docstring_start during parsing.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._extract_docstring_start
nodes.summary: Captures text immediately following opening triple quotes of a docstring.
nodes.mechanism: Searches the stripped line for """, appends trailing content into the accumulator, and signals that docstring processing has begun.
concerns: Assumes module docstrings use double quotes and appear near file top.
opportunities: Support single-quoted triple strings for completeness.
nodes.notes: Works alongside _extract_docstring_end inside _parse_docstring_lines.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._extract_first_meaningful_line
nodes.summary: Chooses the first descriptive docstring line for reporting.
nodes.mechanism: Iterates parsed lines, applies validation and cleanup helpers, and returns the earliest acceptable description for the module.
concerns: Falls back to None when docstrings lack sufficiently long sentences.
opportunities: Consider joining multiple lines for richer summaries when available.
nodes.notes: Called by extract_module_description.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._extract_marker_count
nodes.summary: Return integer count following a marker like '✅ Passed:'.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._extract_numeric_test_count
nodes.summary: Converts formatted test count strings into integers for metrics.
nodes.mechanism: Attempts regex extraction from textual counts, returning zero when unknown or parsing fails.
opportunities: Record parse failures to encourage standardizing module output.
nodes.notes: Used by _analyze_test_output to derive numeric counts.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._extract_test_count_from_output
nodes.summary: Heuristically determines test totals from captured stdout/stderr.
nodes.mechanism: Applies multiple pattern matchers targeting suite emoji output, pass/fail summaries, and fallback heuristics to return human-readable test count text.
concerns: Relies on emoji markers and may fail for third-party output styles.
opportunities: Accept plugin hooks for modules to report counts explicitly.
nodes.notes: Called by _analyze_test_output prior to numeric parse.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._find_failed_count
nodes.summary: Search stdout for a failed-test count marker.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._find_passed_failed_counts
nodes.summary: Searches output for explicit Passed:/Failed: counters.
nodes.mechanism: Iterates lines once, using _extract_count_from_line to capture counts and returning the pair when available.
opportunities: Support additional keywords like Skipped for broader totals.
nodes.notes: Feeds the final fallback pattern aggregator.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._fix_trailing_whitespace
nodes.summary: Pre-flight hygiene step that strips trailing whitespace from targeted Python files.
nodes.mechanism: Iterates configured filenames, rewrites lines without trailing spaces, and silently skips missing or unreadable files.
concerns: Currently hardcodes a single file list; may drift from actual lint requirements.
opportunities: Drive list from configuration or detect dynamically via lint output.
nodes.notes: Invoked by main() before discovery to avoid lint noise.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._format_error_summary
nodes.summary: Format error summary section.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._format_quality_info
nodes.summary: Generates status suffix summarizing quality score and violation counts.
nodes.mechanism: Returns warning, neutral, or pass indicator depending on score thresholds, including violation tallies when available.
opportunities: Add colorization toggle for easier scanning in supported terminals.
nodes.notes: Used by _print_test_result to append quality summary.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._format_timing_analysis
nodes.summary: Format timing analysis section.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._format_violation_message
nodes.summary: Produces bullet-friendly text for a single quality violation.
nodes.mechanism: Extracts function names from violation strings when present and returns a formatted bullet line, falling back to the raw message otherwise.
concerns: String splitting assumes apostrophe-delimited function names.
opportunities: Include severity or line numbers for richer debugging context.
nodes.notes: Feeds display output inside _print_quality_violations.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._generate_module_description
nodes.summary: Produces fallback descriptions from module naming conventions.
nodes.mechanism: Inspects module path patterns (core/, config/, *_utils.py, etc.) and synthesizes a human-friendly phrase when docstrings are absent.
concerns: Pattern list may not cover new directory structures automatically.
opportunities: Allow modules to supply metadata files to override generated labels.
nodes.notes: Called by run_module_tests to ensure every module has display text.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._has_test_function
nodes.summary: Detects whether a module implements the standardized test entry point.
nodes.mechanism: Performs substring checks for run_comprehensive_tests definition or assignment to the shared runner factory.
concerns: String search can produce false positives if mentioned in comments.
opportunities: Parse AST to ensure the function actually exists and adheres to signature expectations.
nodes.notes: Used after file content is read inside discover_test_modules.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._invoke_ruff
nodes.summary: Executes Ruff CLI commands with timeout and output capture.
nodes.mechanism: Builds python -m ruff command, executes via subprocess.run with timeout handling, and returns CompletedProcess for callers to inspect.
concerns: Timeout fallback suppresses failure details beyond warning message.
opportunities: Log timed-out commands to aid diagnosing slow lint operations.
nodes.notes: Utility used by run_linter and _ruff_available.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._is_valid_description_line
nodes.summary: Screens docstring lines to ensure they contain descriptive content.
nodes.mechanism: Rejects separator lines or entries shorter than a threshold so reporting focuses on meaningful sentences.
opportunities: Tune line-length threshold or add stopword filtering for cleaner output.
nodes.notes: Called by _extract_first_meaningful_line.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._monitor_and_collect_results
nodes.summary: Monitor running tests and collect results.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._parse_docstring_lines
nodes.summary: Extracts the module docstring into a list of meaningful lines.
nodes.mechanism: Iterates file lines, skips comments via _should_skip_line, uses docstring start/end helpers to collect content, and trims whitespace-only entries.
concerns: Stops at the first docstring only; modules with multiple headers are ignored.
opportunities: Extend to capture module-level metadata such as author or version tags.
nodes.notes: Feeds extract_module_description before choosing display text.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._print_basic_summary
nodes.summary: Prints overall statistics for the completed test run.
nodes.mechanism: Calculates success rate and outputs duration, test totals, and pass versus fail counts.
opportunities: Emit machine-readable summary alongside console output.
nodes.notes: Called for both sequential and parallel runs.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._print_failed_modules
nodes.summary: Print list of failed modules.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._print_failure_details
nodes.summary: Displays trailing stderr/stdout lines for failed modules.
nodes.mechanism: Prints last few stderr lines, searches stdout for failure indicators, and outputs final lines to aid debugging.
opportunities: Offer richer pattern matching to highlight assertion diffs automatically.
nodes.notes: Called from _print_test_result when success flag false.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._print_final_quality_summary
nodes.summary: Aggregates quality scores across modules and highlights distribution tiers.
nodes.mechanism: Extracts QualityMetrics from collected data, computes averages and thresholds, and prints counts of modules per tier with warnings for low scores.
concerns: Modules without quality metrics are silently excluded from averages.
opportunities: Persist quality histogram for regression analysis over time.
nodes.notes: Skips quietly when quality metrics are unavailable.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._print_final_results
nodes.summary: Summarizes module pass and fail counts by category and flags issues.
nodes.mechanism: Lists failed modules, tallies enhanced versus standard modules, and prints celebratory or warning messaging based on outcomes.
concerns: Relies on description mapping accuracy to classify enhanced modules.
opportunities: Link failed modules to troubleshooting docs or log excerpts.
nodes.notes: Runs regardless of benchmark settings.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._print_nonempty_lines
nodes.summary: Outputs a capped set of non-empty lines from command stdout.
nodes.mechanism: Filters out blank lines, limits to configured count, and prints in order for readability.
opportunities: Allow callers to control whether lines are taken from start or end of output.
nodes.notes: Applied by run_linter for non-blocking diagnostics.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._print_performance_metrics
nodes.summary: Reports averaged performance metrics and saves history when benchmarking is enabled.
nodes.mechanism: Aggregates memory and CPU usage from module metrics, computes parallel efficiency, prints optimization suggestions, and persists metrics to JSON when requested.
concerns: Sampling frequency may underrepresent short-lived spikes in resource usage.
opportunities: Allow configurable retention and opt-out for metrics persistence.
nodes.notes: Only invoked when monitoring is enabled.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._print_quality_violations
nodes.summary: Outputs categorized snapshots of code quality issues when score below 95.
nodes.mechanism: Groups first few violations by category such as Length/Complexity and prints representative entries with indentation.
opportunities: Link to detailed lint hints or documentation for recurring categories.
nodes.notes: Invoked by _print_test_result.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._print_tail
nodes.summary: Prints the last non-empty lines of command output to keep logs concise.
nodes.mechanism: Filters blank lines, slices trailing subset, and emits them sequentially to stdout.
opportunities: Parameterize whether to include headings for clarity.
nodes.notes: Used when Ruff blocking rules fail to show relevant diagnostics.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._print_test_header
nodes.summary: Outputs suite banner describing execution modes.
nodes.mechanism: Prints header text and indicates fast or benchmark mode based on parsed flags.
opportunities: Centralize shared CLI messaging helpers across scripts.
nodes.notes: Presentation-only helper invoked from main.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._print_test_result
nodes.summary: Prints per-module status line with duration, test counts, and quality info.
nodes.mechanism: Formats success emoji, appends quality indicator string, prints quality violations when below threshold, and delegates failure detail printing if needed.
opportunities: Provide quiet mode to reduce console noise during large suites.
nodes.notes: Called by run_module_tests after analyzing output.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._process_cached_module
nodes.summary: Process a cached module and return test count.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._ruff_available
nodes.summary: Detects Ruff availability by running ruff --version.
nodes.mechanism: Delegates to _invoke_ruff and inspects the return code to gate lint execution.
opportunities: Cache results to avoid repeated version calls in a single run.
nodes.notes: Called by run_linter before attempting lint passes.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._run_pre_test_checks
nodes.summary: Runs Ruff linter unless explicitly skipped.
nodes.mechanism: Honors --skip-linter flag and otherwise invokes run_linter to enforce hygiene before continuing the suite.
concerns: Blocking lint run adds latency during frequent local iterations.
opportunities: Cache lint results or provide --lint=skip option for rapid debugging.
nodes.notes: Returns False to abort when blocking lint failures occur.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._run_quality_analysis
nodes.summary: Executes code quality checks against a module when possible.
nodes.mechanism: Detects on-disk module file, instantiates CodeQualityChecker, and returns QualityMetrics or None on failure.
concerns: Exceptions are swallowed, so persistent quality checker failures pass silently.
opportunities: Log suppressed errors to aid debugging when quality analysis fails.
nodes.notes: Results feed _print_test_result quality output and final summary.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._run_test_subprocess
nodes.summary: Runs a module's tests in a subprocess and enforces module-specific timeouts.
nodes.mechanism: Builds command/env, executes via subprocess.run with capture_output, synthesizes timeout failures into CompletedProcess, and returns duration plus start timestamp.
concerns: Timeout list explicitly handles action8 only; consider configuration-driven thresholds.
opportunities: Surface captured stdout/stderr on timeout to simplify diagnosis.
nodes.notes: Used by run_module_tests prior to monitoring aggregation.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._run_tests_sequentially
nodes.summary: Run tests sequentially with caching support.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._setup_test_environment
nodes.summary: Parses CLI flags and sets environment toggles before running tests.
nodes.mechanism: Checks for --fast and --benchmark options, verifies psutil availability, and sets SKIP_* environment variables before returning execution flags.
concerns: Monitoring quietly disables itself when psutil is missing.
opportunities: Consider using argparse for clearer usage messaging.
nodes.notes: Called early from main to gate later features.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._should_skip_cache_or_temp_file
nodes.summary: Skips cached, backup, temp, or virtualenv artifacts while crawling for tests.
nodes.mechanism: Converts the path to string and short-circuits when markers such as __pycache__, .venv, Logs, or backup suffixes are detected.
concerns: Broad substring checks could miss newly introduced build directories.
opportunities: Share ignore logic with repo-level tooling like Ruff or git attributes.
nodes.notes: Pairs with other skip helpers inside discover_test_modules.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._should_skip_demo_file
nodes.summary: Drops demo or experimental scripts from the discovered test set.
nodes.mechanism: Lowercases filenames and looks for keywords like demo, prototype, experimental, or sandbox.
opportunities: Expand markers list or accept overrides for one-off showcase modules.
nodes.notes: Runs after cache exclusion when scanning files.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._should_skip_interactive_file
nodes.summary: Avoids running interactive-only utilities as part of the automated suite.
nodes.mechanism: Matches filenames against a small allowlist of interactive tools such as db_viewer.py and test_program_executor.py.
concerns: List must stay in sync if more interactive helpers are introduced.
opportunities: Allow tagging files via metadata to mark them as interactive instead of hardcoding names.
nodes.notes: Invoked for each candidate in discover_test_modules.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._should_skip_line
nodes.summary: Determines whether a source line should be ignored when parsing module docstrings.
nodes.mechanism: Treats blank strings and comment-prefixed lines as ignorable to find meaningful docstring content quickly.
opportunities: Extend skipping rules to handle encoding declarations or type ignore pragmas.
nodes.notes: Helper for _parse_docstring_lines.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._should_skip_system_file
nodes.summary: Filters out runner and root __init__ modules during discovery scans.
nodes.mechanism: Checks filenames against a blocklist and treats only the project-root __init__.py as skippable so package initializers remain eligible.
concerns: Hardcoded exclusions require maintenance when more infrastructure files are added.
opportunities: Drive the exclusion list from configuration shared with other tooling.
nodes.notes: First guard applied in discover_test_modules.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._try_pattern_all_tests_completed
nodes.summary: Targets 'All X tests completed/passed' messaging to extract counts.
nodes.mechanism: Removes ANSI codes, then uses regex for "All/Total <n> tests" phrases tied to success words.
opportunities: Expand vocabulary of success verbs (e.g., executed, verified).
nodes.notes: Useful for high-level success banners.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._try_pattern_all_tests_passed_with_counts
nodes.summary: Handles uppercase 'ALL TESTS PASSED' messages with adjacent counts.
nodes.mechanism: Detects the banner line and searches nearby output for 'Passed:' totals to report combined counts.
concerns: Assumes count lines follow the banner; may miss asynchronous logs.
opportunities: Track last seen count while scanning to avoid second pass.
nodes.notes: Catches celebratory all-pass summaries.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._try_pattern_number_followed_by_test
nodes.summary: Searches for generic '<number> tests' phrases in output.
nodes.mechanism: Uses regex to capture digits preceding the word 'tests' (with optional qualifiers) and returns the parsed count.
concerns: Can misinterpret unrelated statistics mentioning tests.
opportunities: Add context checks to ensure the line references execution results.
nodes.notes: Broad safety net for varied textual summaries.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._try_pattern_numbered_tests
nodes.summary: Counts enumerated "Test N:" labels to infer total cases.
nodes.mechanism: Applies regex over cleaned lines to collect numeric suffixes from test headings and returns their cardinality.
concerns: May undercount when numbering resets per section.
opportunities: Track highest observed test number as alternate heuristic.
nodes.notes: Handles custom reporters that label each test sequentially.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._try_pattern_passed_failed
nodes.summary: Parses emoji-formatted pass/fail summaries to infer total tests run.
nodes.mechanism: Scans stdout for "✅ Passed" and "❌ Failed" markers, handling split-line counts to return combined totals.
concerns: Assumes emoji markers remain consistent across test output styles.
opportunities: Support configurable symbols for custom reporters.
nodes.notes: First heuristic attempted by _extract_test_count_from_output.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._try_pattern_passed_failed_ansi
nodes.summary: Removes ANSI color codes before parsing emoji pass/fail counts.
nodes.mechanism: Uses regex to strip escape sequences, then reuses the emoji markers to compute totals even with colored output.
concerns: Limited to basic ANSI patterns and may miss nested sequences.
opportunities: Share escape removal utility with other log parsing helpers.
nodes.notes: Fallback when reporters emit colorized status lines.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._try_pattern_passed_failed_counts_any
nodes.summary: Fallback heuristic that sums any discovered Passed:/Failed: totals.
nodes.mechanism: Calls _find_passed_failed_counts and, when counts exist, returns the combined total as a test count estimate.
concerns: Can double-count when output contains historical summaries.
opportunities: Ignore lines flagged as summary archives or past runs.
nodes.notes: Last-resort pattern in _extract_test_count_from_output.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._try_pattern_tests_passed
nodes.summary: Detects X/Y tests passed style output and extracts the denominator.
nodes.mechanism: Splits lines containing "tests passed" and a slash, capturing the total count segment for reporting.
opportunities: Handle localized language variants of the phrase.
nodes.notes: Used when reporters print combined pass ratios.

nodes.name: run_all_tests._try_pattern_unittest_ran
nodes.summary: Matches Python unittest "Ran X tests in Ys" style output.
nodes.mechanism: Strips ANSI codes, locates the word "Ran", and converts the following token into an integer count.
opportunities: Support doctest and pytest variants that share similar phrasing.
nodes.notes: Covers the default unittest runner format.

nodes.name: run_all_tests.analyze_application_logs
nodes.summary: Parses Ancestry application logs for error counts and API timing insights.
nodes.mechanism: Loads log content, applies regex searches to tally errors, warnings, API timing records, and aggregates throughput metrics into a dictionary.
concerns: Reads entire log file into memory, which may be expensive for long runs.
opportunities: Implement streaming analysis to handle multi-GB logs safely.
nodes.notes: Defaults to Logs/app.log or LOG_FILE environment override.

nodes.name: run_all_tests.analyze_performance_trends
nodes.summary: Evaluates collected metrics to suggest performance optimizations.
nodes.mechanism: Scans module metrics for slow duration, high memory, and high CPU usage outliers, adding textual hints and recommending parallel mode when total runtime is high.
concerns: Thresholds are hard-coded and may need tuning for different hardware.
opportunities: Incorporate percentile analysis or failure correlations for smarter advice.
nodes.notes: Returns suggestion strings consumed by _print_performance_metrics.

nodes.name: run_all_tests.discover_test_modules
nodes.summary: Locates all project modules that expose the standard run_comprehensive_tests hook.
nodes.mechanism: Walks the repository tree, skips infrastructure and temporary files via helper filters, reads Python source, and collects relative paths when the test hook string is found.
concerns: Reading every Python file can be slow; large modules add I/O overhead.
opportunities: Cache discovery results or reuse git metadata to avoid scanning unchanged trees.
nodes.notes: Feeds _discover_and_prepare_modules with a sorted module list.

nodes.name: run_all_tests.extract_module_description
nodes.summary: Derives human-readable descriptions from module docstrings for reporting.
nodes.mechanism: Reads module source, feeds it to _parse_docstring_lines, and selects the first meaningful line via _extract_first_meaningful_line.
concerns: Entire file read could be expensive for large modules and lacks caching.
opportunities: Cache descriptions to avoid repeated file reads across runs.
nodes.notes: Used by _discover_and_prepare_modules when enriching module listings.

nodes.name: run_all_tests.format_log_analysis
nodes.summary: Formats log analysis metrics into a multi-section textual report.
nodes.mechanism: Builds summary lines for errors, warnings, throughput, and timing stats, including estimated completion for remaining pages.
concerns: Assumes a fixed workload of 802 pages when estimating completion time.
opportunities: Parameterize workload size or derive from log metadata.
nodes.notes: Consumed by print_log_analysis and CLI flag handling.

nodes.name: run_all_tests.main
nodes.summary: Drives comprehensive test run including environment prep, execution, and reporting.
nodes.mechanism: Fixes trailing whitespace, configures flags, optionally performs log analysis, coordinates discovery and execution, prints summaries, and returns success state.
concerns: Sequential pass count recomputation could drift if results are mutated later.
opportunities: Refactor reporting into reusable formatter for CI integration.
nodes.notes: Invoked via __main__ guard and callable from other tooling.

nodes.name: run_all_tests.optimize_test_order
nodes.summary: Reorders discovered modules based on historical duration and recent failures.
nodes.mechanism: Reads Logs/test_metrics_history.json, groups modules into fast, failed, slow, or unknown buckets, sorts by duration, and returns concatenated order for faster feedback.
concerns: Falls back to legacy order when metrics file missing or malformed.
opportunities: Incorporate per-module flakiness weighting to surface unstable suites sooner.
nodes.notes: Applied by _discover_and_prepare_modules when --fast flag supplied.

nodes.name: run_all_tests.print_log_analysis
nodes.summary: RESERVED: Generates and prints the formatted log analysis report.
nodes.mechanism: Invokes analyze_application_logs and passes results to format_log_analysis before printing to stdout.
opportunities: Provide option to export summary to file for CI artifacts.
nodes.notes: RESERVED FOR FUTURE DEVELOPMENT: Fully implemented for --analyze-logs mode. Will provide post-run analysis of application logs for performance insights and error tracking.

nodes.name: run_all_tests.run_linter
nodes.summary: Executes Ruff auto-fix and blocking rule checks prior to running tests.
nodes.mechanism: Runs Ruff fix-all, enforces critical error selection, prints diagnostic statistics, and aborts on blocking violations.
concerns: Configured timeouts may be tight for large repositories.
opportunities: Emit structured lint summary for CI dashboards.
nodes.notes: Called through _run_pre_test_checks before module discovery.

nodes.name: run_all_tests.run_module_tests
nodes.summary: Runs a module's comprehensive tests with optional performance and quality analysis.
nodes.mechanism: Starts performance monitoring when enabled, executes module in subprocess, parses output for success metrics, runs code quality checks, and prints status summary.
concerns: Output parsing depends on specific message patterns that may change.
opportunities: Adopt structured IPC or JSON to report results without string heuristics.
nodes.notes: Used by both sequential loop and parallel executor.

nodes.name: run_all_tests.run_quality_checks
nodes.summary: RESERVED: Runs CodeQualityChecker across curated files and aggregates scores for reporting.
nodes.mechanism: Instantiates CodeQualityChecker, iterates through a hard-coded file list when present, accumulates quality scores, and flags failure when the average dips below 70.
concerns: Static file list may fall out of sync with actual critical modules.
opportunities: Allow configuration or reuse discovery to select analysis targets dynamically.
nodes.notes: RESERVED FOR FUTURE DEVELOPMENT: Fully implemented quality gate. Will enable automated code quality enforcement during test runs with configurable thresholds.

nodes.name: run_all_tests.run_tests_parallel
nodes.summary: Executes module test suites concurrently using a thread pool.
nodes.mechanism: Determines worker count, submits run_module_tests tasks, waits for completion, and aggregates success counts and metrics from futures.
concerns: Thread-based execution assumes suites are free of shared-resource conflicts.
opportunities: Evaluate process-based parallelism to isolate interpreter state.
nodes.notes: Activated when --fast flag is present.

nodes.name: run_all_tests.save_performance_metrics
nodes.summary: Persists suite and module performance metrics to JSON history.
nodes.mechanism: Loads existing test_performance_metrics.json when present, appends the latest metrics snapshot capped to the most recent 50 runs, and writes formatted JSON back to disk with error handling.
concerns: Lack of file locking could race when multiple runners execute concurrently.
opportunities: Stream metrics to a central analytics service for richer dashboards.
nodes.notes: Invoked when benchmark mode is active to retain historical trends.

nodes.name: run_all_tests.update_test_history
nodes.summary: Persists execution duration and success booleans for future ordering heuristics.
nodes.mechanism: Loads Logs/test_metrics_history.json, maintains running averages and last run metadata, and writes updated JSON after each module completion.
concerns: Lacks concurrency guard when parallel execution updates history simultaneously.
opportunities: Capture additional metrics like failure counts for smarter prioritization.
nodes.notes: Invoked from sequential path inside _execute_tests.

nodes.name: APIManager.clear_identifiers
nodes.summary: Clear all stored identifiers.

nodes.name: APIManager.get_csrf_token
nodes.summary: Fetches CSRF token via configured endpoint and stores it for subsequent requests.
nodes.mechanism: Calls make_api_request without CSRF header, inspects multiple key names in JSON response, caches value if found.
concerns: Lacks validation on token length/format; may accept malformed strings.
opportunities: Add sanity checks or expiration handling aligned with SessionManager caching.
nodes.notes: Non-critical if token missing; logs at debug level.

nodes.name: APIManager.get_profile_id
nodes.summary: Retrieves profile ID (ucdmid) from personalization endpoint and caches it.
nodes.mechanism: Uses make_api_request, fetches ucdmid from nested data payload, stores in my_profile_id, and rate-limits logging.
concerns: Assumes ucdmid present either at root or under data; API contract changes could break silently.
opportunities: Consider enforcing uppercase normalization like SessionManager does for UUIDs.
nodes.notes: Acts as source for SessionManager identifier cache.

nodes.name: APIManager.has_essential_identifiers
nodes.summary: Check if essential identifiers are available.

nodes.name: APIManager.load_cookies_from_file
nodes.summary: Loads cookies from JSON file into requests session to enable browserless API calls.
nodes.mechanism: Reads cookie list, clears session cookies, then adds each name/value with stored domain/path metadata.
concerns: Silently skips malformed cookie entries; difficult to debug incorrect formats.
opportunities: Log summary of skipped cookies or provide validation utility.
nodes.notes: Uses repo-root ancestry_cookies.json when path unspecified.

nodes.name: APIManager.make_api_request
nodes.summary: Executes HTTP requests through the shared session with optional CSRF injection and response parsing.
nodes.mechanism: Builds default headers, attaches CSRF token when requested, performs requests.Session.request, raises for status, and parses JSON/text fallback.
concerns: Logs 401s at debug level but treats other failures as generic errors; may need richer error taxonomy.
opportunities: Surface response metadata (status, duration) to analytics for rate-limit monitoring.
nodes.notes: Centralizes timeout and redirect handling for API calls.

nodes.name: APIManager.request
nodes.summary: Unified API request method with rate limiting, retries, and cookie sync.

nodes.name: APIManager.requests_session
nodes.summary: Get the requests session.

nodes.name: APIManager.reset_logged_flags
nodes.summary: Reset flags used to prevent repeated logging of IDs.

nodes.name: APIManager.retrieve_all_identifiers
nodes.summary: Ensures profile ID, UUID, and CSRF token are populated through helper checks.
nodes.mechanism: Calls _ensure_profile_id, _ensure_uuid, and _ensure_csrf, aggregating success state for essential identifiers.
concerns: Returns True even if CSRF retrieval fails; caller must inspect warnings separately.
_ensure_uuid merely logs error because SessionManager owns UUID fetch, leading to confusing control flow.
opportunities: Refactor identifier ownership so UUID retrieval resides entirely within APIManager.
nodes.notes: Used by SessionManager readiness checks to populate API-side identifiers.

nodes.name: APIManager.sanitize_endpoint_label
nodes.summary: Normalize URL paths to stable metric labels.

nodes.name: APIManager.sync_cookies_from_browser
nodes.summary: Transfers cookies from BrowserManager into the pooled requests session with recovery retry.
nodes.mechanism: Validates browser session, clears existing cookies, deduplicates by name/path, and injects into requests.Session; on invalid session attempts recovery via SessionManager.
concerns: Recursion guard depends on passing session_manager=None after recovery; fragile if callers change signature.
Swallows exceptions into False, limiting insight into underlying Selenium failures.
opportunities: Return structured result capturing counts and failure reason for analytics.
nodes.notes: Deduplicates cookies preferring more specific domains before sync.

nodes.name: APIManager.verify_api_login_status
nodes.summary: Determines if user is authenticated by probing profile endpoint without re-syncing cookies.
nodes.mechanism: Skips cookie sync to avoid recursion, requests profile ID, and interprets failure as not logged in.
concerns: Only checks profile endpoint; lacks fallback heuristics for partial login states.
opportunities: Augment with secondary probe or analytics events to differentiate network vs auth failure.
nodes.notes: Returns None only when unable to determine status; otherwise boolean.

nodes.name: BrowserManager.__init__
nodes.summary: Initialize the BrowserManager.

nodes.name: BrowserManager._load_saved_cookies
nodes.summary: Restores persisted login cookies into a freshly launched WebDriver session before backgrounding the window.
nodes.mechanism: Constructs lightweight cookie loader wrapper, imports utils._load_login_cookies lazily, invokes it against the active driver, and logs whether cookies were applied.
concerns: Broad exception handler downgrades all failures to warning-level message, masking root causes like file permissions.
opportunities: Surface loaded/failed counts to SessionManager for telemetry and potential retry decisions.
nodes.notes: Called during browser startup to reuse prior authentication state when available.

nodes.name: BrowserManager._log_browser_initialization_error
nodes.summary: Log detailed browser initialization error message.

nodes.name: BrowserManager._minimize_browser_window
nodes.summary: Minimize browser window after launch.

nodes.name: BrowserManager._restore_terminal_focus
nodes.summary: Force focus back to the console window on Windows.

nodes.name: BrowserManager._verify_browser_window
nodes.summary: Verify browser window is actually open.

nodes.name: BrowserManager.close_browser
nodes.summary: Closes WebDriver safely, suppressing Windows handle errors and resetting state flags.
nodes.mechanism: Redirects stderr, quits driver, waits briefly for handle release, clears driver reference, and resets browser_needed/driver_live flags.
concerns: Multiple driver = None assignments exist; ensure future edits don’t reintroduce GC issues.
opportunities: Emit analytics event summarizing closure reason when called from SessionManager restarts.
nodes.notes: Ensures driver reference cleared even if quit raises.

nodes.name: BrowserManager.create_new_tab
nodes.summary: Opens a new tab via JavaScript and switches focus, returning the new handle.
nodes.mechanism: Stores original handle, executes window.open script, iterates handles to find new one, switches context, returns handle.
concerns: No timeout protection; long-running JS execution could hang call.
opportunities: Add optional timeout/exception handling for scenarios with pop-up blockers.
nodes.notes: Currently unused in most flows but available for multi-tab automation.

nodes.name: BrowserManager.ensure_driver_live
nodes.summary: Ensures browser is started when browser_needed=True, otherwise short-circuits.
nodes.mechanism: Returns True immediately if browser not required or session valid; otherwise delegates to start_browser.
concerns: Relies on browser_needed flag managed externally; incorrect flag could skip required restart.
opportunities: Expose optional force flag to bypass browser_needed when higher layers detect stale session.
nodes.notes: Primary entry point for SessionManager readiness checks.

nodes.name: BrowserManager.get_cookies
nodes.summary: Waits for required browser cookies within timeout, logging missing sets before failing.
nodes.mechanism: Validates session, polls driver.get_cookies, compares case-insensitive names, and waits up to timeout with 0.5s polling interval.
concerns: Returns False for any exception, losing specific error context (e.g., driver None mid-loop).
opportunities: Return tuple with missing cookie list to aid troubleshooting in SessionManager.
nodes.notes: Ensures sequential cookie availability ahead of API sync.

nodes.name: BrowserManager.is_session_valid
nodes.summary: Checks driver health by probing current_url and resets flags on known WebDriver exceptions.
nodes.mechanism: Returns False when driver missing or not live, catches InvalidSessionId/NoSuchWindow/WebDriverException to flag invalid session.
concerns: Logs unexpected exceptions at error level, which may spam logs on transient issues.
opportunities: Differentiate recoverable vs fatal exceptions for better logging severity control.
nodes.notes: Used by SessionManager to decide if restart needed.

nodes.name: BrowserManager.start_browser
nodes.summary: Bootstraps WebDriver instance, navigates to base URL, loads saved cookies, and minimizes window before marking session live.
nodes.mechanism: Calls init_webdvr, verifies window, navigates using nav_to_page, loads cookies via utils._load_login_cookies shim, and updates timing flags.
concerns: Swallows detailed nav_to_page failure reasons; only logs generic error then closes browser.
opportunities: Return result object capturing navigation failure details for SessionManager telemetry.
nodes.notes: Minimizes Chrome to avoid visual noise on operator desktops.

nodes.name: CircuitBreaker.__init__
nodes.summary: Initializes thresholds, state tracking, and metrics for the circuit breaker.
nodes.mechanism: Stores failure thresholds, configures threading.Lock for thread safety, and seeds metrics counters used for observability.
concerns: Metrics dictionary grows only through counters; external visibility limited to get_metrics copies.
opportunities: Allow callers to inject monitoring hooks instead of relying solely on log statements.
nodes.notes: Called whenever a new CircuitBreaker instance is created, typically at SessionManager startup.

nodes.name: CircuitBreaker._handle_failure_locked
nodes.summary: Method _handle_failure_locked.

nodes.name: CircuitBreaker._handle_success_locked
nodes.summary: Method _handle_success_locked.

nodes.name: CircuitBreaker.call
nodes.summary: Executes a callable under circuit breaker control, blocking when state is OPEN or HALF_OPEN limits reached.
nodes.mechanism: Guards execution with lock-protected state checks, transitions OPEN→HALF_OPEN after timeout, executes function outside lock, and records success or failure results.
concerns: Uses generic Exception for OPEN state blocking, which may be indistinguishable from underlying failures to callers.
opportunities: Raise custom exception type so callers can react differently to circuit-blocked requests.
nodes.notes: Key entry point that counts total and blocked requests while coordinating state transitions.

nodes.name: CircuitBreaker.get_stats
nodes.summary: Get circuit breaker statistics.

nodes.name: CircuitBreaker.record_failure
nodes.summary: Records throttling failures, transitions to OPEN, and resets success counters.
nodes.mechanism: Increments failure count inside lock, captures timestamp, and invokes _transition_to_open when thresholds exceeded or in HALF_OPEN state.
concerns: Relies on time.time() without monotonic clock, which can jump backward if system clock adjusts.
opportunities: Switch to time.monotonic() for resilience against clock skew during long runs.
nodes.notes: Triggered when call() catches errors containing 429 indicators.

nodes.name: CircuitBreaker.record_success
nodes.summary: Updates breaker state after a successful request and closes HALF_OPEN circuits when thresholds met.
nodes.mechanism: Resets failure counter, increments success metrics, and triggers _transition_to_closed when enough HALF_OPEN successes occur.
concerns: Success threshold equals half_open_max_requests; lacks adaptive logic for differing recovery strategies.
opportunities: Expose configurable policy for closing criteria separate from HALF_OPEN request allowance.
nodes.notes: Called from call() on successful function execution.

nodes.name: CircuitBreaker.reset
nodes.summary: Resets breaker to CLOSED state, clearing counters and timers.
nodes.mechanism: Within lock, sets state to CLOSED, zeroes counters, clears last failure time, and logs reset message.
concerns: Reset does not affect metrics history, so monitoring may misinterpret repeated resets as continuous operation.
opportunities: Optionally reset metrics or expose reset count for clearer observability.
nodes.notes: Used when manual recovery is performed or during automated health checks.

nodes.name: CodeQualityChecker.__init__
nodes.summary: Initializes violation tracking structures.
nodes.mechanism: Seeds in-memory dictionaries and lists for later population of per-file metrics and rule breaches.
concerns: Does not accept configuration overrides; consumers must mutate attributes after construction.
opportunities: Allow injection of rule configuration to support different project standards.

nodes.name: CodeQualityChecker._analyze_ast
nodes.summary: Traverses AST to compute metrics and collect violations.
nodes.mechanism: Iterates functions, checks annotations, calculates length and complexity, and evaluates mutable defaults before building QualityMetrics.
concerns: Length threshold of 400 lines is extremely high and may miss overly large functions.
opportunities: Parameterize thresholds and reuse for targeted refactoring reports.

nodes.name: CodeQualityChecker._calculate_complexity
nodes.summary: Computes simplified cyclomatic complexity score.
nodes.mechanism: Walks function AST to count branching constructs such as if/loop/except nodes, starting from base 1.
concerns: Treats boolean operators as individual branches without weighting nested conditions differently.
opportunities: Adopt full cyclomatic formula or integrate radon metrics for richer insights.

nodes.name: CodeQualityChecker._find_type_ignore_violations
nodes.summary: Detect disallowed `type: ignore` directives within file content.

nodes.name: CodeQualityChecker._has_mutable_defaults
nodes.summary: Detects mutable default arguments in function definitions.
nodes.mechanism: Scans default values for list, dict, or set literals and flags them as violations.
concerns: Does not inspect keyword-only defaults, missing part of the signature.
opportunities: Extend to keyword defaults and consider tuple-of-mutable patterns as well.

nodes.name: CodeQualityChecker._has_type_hints
nodes.summary: Determines whether a function includes annotations.
nodes.mechanism: Checks for return annotation and argument annotations among positional parameters to qualify coverage.
concerns: Ignores keyword-only and positional-only parameters, undercounting hints in modern signatures.
opportunities: Inspect kwonlyargs and posonlyargs to account for all function parameter kinds.

nodes.name: CodeQualityChecker.check_directory
nodes.summary: Recursively walks directories and analyzes eligible Python files.
nodes.mechanism: Applies exclusion patterns, depth limit, and calls check_file for each discovered module, assembling a metrics dictionary keyed by path.
concerns: Depth guard skips nested packages, so large subsystems may never be evaluated.
opportunities: Allow configurable depth or explicit include lists for targeted scans.

nodes.name: CodeQualityChecker.check_file
nodes.summary: Loads source file and analyzes it for quality issues.
nodes.mechanism: Reads file contents, builds AST, delegates to _analyze_ast, and wraps failures in a sentinel QualityMetrics payload.
concerns: Broad exception handler only logs error message, forfeiting stack context for debugging.
opportunities: Surface exception data alongside metrics so CI consumers can fail fast on syntax errors.

nodes.name: CodeQualityChecker.generate_report
nodes.summary: Formats aggregated metrics into a human-readable report string.
nodes.mechanism: Calculates totals and averages, sorts results by quality score, and summarizes violations with bullet-point output.
concerns: Only returns plain text, forcing callers to parse output to integrate with dashboards.
opportunities: Emit structured JSON or markdown tables alongside console-friendly text.

nodes.name: DatabaseManager._initialize_engine_and_session
nodes.summary: Constructs SQLAlchemy engine with tuned pooling config and prepares session factory.
nodes.mechanism: Disposes stale engines, computes pool sizing, builds engine with pragmas, attaches listeners, and issues metadata create_all on first run.
concerns: Large try/except spans complicate pinpointing which step failed without deep logs.
opportunities: Split configuration, engine creation, and metadata bootstrap into dedicated helpers for clarity and testing.
nodes.notes: Logs critical on failure and resets init flags to allow retry.

nodes.name: DatabaseManager._normalize_query_label
nodes.summary: Reduce query objects to a low-cardinality label for metrics.

nodes.name: DatabaseManager._record_db_query_metrics
nodes.summary: Emit Prometheus metrics for database operations.

nodes.name: DatabaseManager._rollback_session_if_active
nodes.summary: Rollback session if active.

nodes.name: DatabaseManager._run_schema_migrations
nodes.summary: Apply registered schema migrations using the shared migrator.

nodes.name: DatabaseManager._update_connection_stats
nodes.summary: Update connection and query statistics.

nodes.name: DatabaseManager.batch_operation_context
nodes.summary: Provides commit batching helpers for high-volume insert/update loops.
nodes.mechanism: Yields session alongside add_to_batch/commit_batch closures, committing when batch thresholds reached and handling rollback on failure.
concerns: Closures maintain implicit state; misuse outside context could leave transactions open.
opportunities: Return lightweight helper object instead of closures to clarify lifecycle.
nodes.notes: Action 6 leverage point for bulk DNA match persistence.

nodes.name: DatabaseManager.close_connections
nodes.summary: Closes sessions and optionally disposes engine, resetting initialization flags.
nodes.mechanism: On dispose_engine=True, calls engine.dispose(), clears engine/session references, and flips _db_init_attempted; otherwise logs no-op.
concerns: Non-dispose path currently only logs; callers expecting idle pool shrinkage may misinterpret behavior.
opportunities: Clarify semantics in docstring or return status to reduce misuse.
nodes.notes: Invoked by SessionManager restarts and shutdown routines.

nodes.name: DatabaseManager.ensure_ready
nodes.summary: Guarantees engine and session factory exist before work proceeds, toggling readiness flag.
nodes.mechanism: Checks cached engine/session, lazily triggers initialization, records readiness state, and logs failures.
concerns: Sets _db_ready even if initialization later fails elsewhere; state can drift if exceptions escape callers.
opportunities: Return richer status info (error details, init timings) to aid upstream diagnostics.
nodes.notes: Primary entry point accessed via SessionManager.ensure_db_ready().

nodes.name: DatabaseManager.execute_query_with_timing
nodes.summary: Execute a query with performance timing.

nodes.name: DatabaseManager.get_db_path
nodes.summary: Get the database path.

nodes.name: DatabaseManager.get_performance_stats
nodes.summary: Exposes collected pool/query counters with derived health indicators.
nodes.mechanism: Copies internal stats dict, computes success and overflow rates, adds pool metadata and health labels before returning.
concerns: Success rate assumes total_connections>0; initial zero-state still reports 'good' health even if engine absent.
opportunities: Include timestamp of last reset so operators know freshness of metrics.
nodes.notes: Useful for telemetry dashboards and manual diagnostics.

nodes.name: DatabaseManager.get_session
nodes.summary: Obtains SQLAlchemy Session from pool with lazy engine bootstrap and telemetry updates.
nodes.mechanism: Initializes engine if needed, creates session via sessionmaker, increments active counts, and tracks connection timing.
concerns: Resets engine on any exception, potentially discarding healthy pool during transient issues.
opportunities: Differentiate recoverable errors to avoid full engine dispose when unnecessary.
nodes.notes: SessionManager and batch helpers rely on this as their acquisition path.

nodes.name: DatabaseManager.get_session_context
nodes.summary: Context manager yielding session with automatic commit/rollback and cleanup.
nodes.mechanism: Acquires session, yields to caller, commits on success, rolls back on errors, always returns session to pool.
concerns: Nested context usage may double-close sessions if callers also call return_session manually.
opportunities: Document idempotency expectations to prevent redundant cleanup.
nodes.notes: Wraps core CRUD operations invoked by action modules.

nodes.name: DatabaseManager.is_ready
nodes.summary: Check if the database manager is ready.

nodes.name: DatabaseManager.return_session
nodes.summary: Closes a Session and updates active connection counters, tracking leaks on failure.
nodes.mechanism: Calls session.close(), decrements active count safely, increments leak counter when close raises.
concerns: Only logs when session is None; callers repeatedly passing None could hide logic issues.
opportunities: Emit telemetry when leak counter increments to correlate with caller context.
nodes.notes: Used by both sync and async context managers for cleanup.

nodes.name: GedcomData._build_family_maps
nodes.summary: Construct parent/child lookup maps from family records.
nodes.mechanism: Scans FAM entries, extracts spouse and child IDs, and populates bidirectional maps while tracking skipped links.
concerns: Full scan can be expensive for massive files; lacks incremental updates.
opportunities: Persist map snapshots to reuse across runs.

nodes.name: GedcomData._build_indi_index
nodes.summary: Index GEDCOM individual records by normalized ID.
nodes.mechanism: Iterates INDI records via ged4py, filters invalid entries, normalizes IDs, and tracks timing plus skipped counts for logging.
concerns: Logs at DEBUG extensively; consider structured metrics for large files.
opportunities: Expose iterator hooks for streaming progress updates.

nodes.name: GedcomData._normalize_gender_value
nodes.summary: Method _normalize_gender_value.

nodes.name: GedcomData._pre_process_individual_data
nodes.summary: Extract and cache display/scoring attributes for each individual.
nodes.mechanism: Iterates normalized IDs, derives formatted names, gender, vitals, and stores them in processed_data_cache with timing metrics.
concerns: Collects large dictionaries in memory; monitor footprint for huge datasets.
opportunities: Persist processed cache to disk to accelerate restarts.

nodes.name: GedcomData._process_child_in_family
nodes.summary: Process a child tag and update family maps. Returns (processed, skipped).

nodes.name: GedcomData._process_indi_record
nodes.summary: Process an individual record for indexing. Returns (processed, skipped).

nodes.name: GedcomData._run_relationship_search
nodes.summary: Execute the FastBiBFS search and return path IDs with timing.

nodes.name: GedcomData._validate_relationship_path_inputs
nodes.summary: Validate inputs for relationship path calculation. Returns error message or None if valid.

nodes.name: GedcomData.build_caches
nodes.summary: Kick off index, family map, and processed data cache construction.
nodes.mechanism: Guards for reader availability, rebuilds the individual index, then populates family graphs and processed attribute caches.
concerns: Calls multiple private helpers sequentially without granular error recovery.
opportunities: Return explicit status to callers for improved diagnostics.

nodes.name: GedcomData.find_individual_by_id
nodes.summary: Finds an individual by their normalized ID using the index.

nodes.name: GedcomData.from_cache
nodes.summary: Create a GedcomData instance from cached data.

nodes.name: GedcomData.get_processed_indi_data
nodes.summary: Return cached individual summary data by normalized ID.
nodes.mechanism: Refreshes cache on-demand when empty and fetches processed_data_cache entries for scoring and presentation calls.
opportunities: Return immutable views to prevent accidental caller mutation.

nodes.name: GedcomData.get_related_individuals
nodes.summary: Lookup parents, children, siblings, or spouses using cached maps.
nodes.mechanism: Normalizes target IDs, ensures maps exist, resolves related IDs, and converts them back into Individual objects for downstream use.
concerns: Returns empty list on errors; consider surfacing failure context.
opportunities: Support relationship graph previews for presenter tooling.

nodes.name: GedcomData.get_relationship_path
nodes.summary: Explain relationship between two IDs using cached maps and BFS traversal.
nodes.mechanism: Normalizes inputs, validates caches, runs fast_bidirectional_bfs, and formats the result via explain_relationship_path for CLI display.
concerns: Returns formatted string intermixed with profile telemetry; separation could improve reuse.
opportunities: Expose structured path alongside text for presenter customization.

nodes.name: QualityMetrics.quality_score
nodes.summary: Derives composite quality score combining annotations, complexity, and violations.
nodes.mechanism: Blends type hint coverage with weighted penalties for long/complex functions and recorded rule breaches, clamping to 0-100.
concerns: Penalty weights are hard-coded; tuning requires code edits rather than configuration.
opportunities: Expose weighting configuration so teams can align scoring with evolving standards.

nodes.name: QualityMetrics.type_hint_coverage
nodes.summary: Computes percentage of analyzed functions that include type hints.
nodes.mechanism: Returns 100 when no functions exist, otherwise divides annotated count by total and scales to percent.
concerns: Treats pytest-style tests as fully annotated, which can overstate coverage ratios.
opportunities: Differentiate production vs. test functions to publish two coverage metrics.

nodes.name: RelationshipPathCache.__init__
nodes.summary: Initialize the cache with a maximum size.

nodes.name: RelationshipPathCache._make_key
nodes.summary: Creates an order-independent cache key from two person IDs.
nodes.mechanism: Sorts the provided IDs to guarantee bidirectional lookups map to the same tuple key.
opportunities: Normalize IDs (upper-case) before sorting to avoid duplicates.
nodes.notes: Shared by get and put when interacting with the cache store.

nodes.name: RelationshipPathCache.clear
nodes.summary: Resets cached paths and associated statistics counters.
nodes.mechanism: Clears the OrderedDict storage and zeroes hit/miss/query counters to provide a fresh cache state.
nodes.notes: Used by clear_relationship_cache and cache regression tests.

nodes.name: RelationshipPathCache.get
nodes.summary: Retrieves a cached path using the normalized key ordering.
nodes.mechanism: Increments query counters, generates a bidirectional key via _make_key, and moves hits to the MRU end of the OrderedDict.
opportunities: Record timestamp of last access for richer telemetry.
nodes.notes: Called by fast_bidirectional_bfs before executing a search.

nodes.name: RelationshipPathCache.get_stats
nodes.summary: Returns cache size and hit/miss counters for monitoring.
nodes.mechanism: Calculates hit rate percentage from tracked counters and exposes current/max sizes in a dictionary payload.
opportunities: Emit rolling hit rate averages for smoother trend analysis.
nodes.notes: Consumed by monitoring helpers and regression tests.

nodes.name: RelationshipPathCache.put
nodes.summary: Stores a path result and enforces LRU eviction policy.
nodes.mechanism: Builds the normalized key, inserts/updates the OrderedDict entry, and pops the oldest entry when capacity is exceeded.
opportunities: Log evictions when cache churn exceeds expectations.
nodes.notes: Invoked by fast_bidirectional_bfs after computing a path.

nodes.name: SessionManager._build_endpoint_profile_config
nodes.summary: Normalizes endpoint-specific throttle configuration into a sanitized dict for the rate limiter.
nodes.mechanism: Reads config_schema.api.endpoint_throttle_profiles, filters to dict entries, and clones values to avoid mutating shared config objects.
concerns: Silently ignores non-dict entries instead of alerting configuration authors to mistakes.
opportunities: Log discarded entries with context so misconfigurations are surfaced during testing.
nodes.notes: Feeding sanitized profiles to _calculate_endpoint_rate_cap and get_rate_limiter.

nodes.name: SessionManager._calculate_endpoint_rate_cap
nodes.summary: Derives the tightest allowable rate from endpoint throttle definitions to cap global limiter settings.
nodes.mechanism: Iterates provided profiles, collects max_rate and min_interval values, converts to candidate rates, and returns lowest positive rate when present.
concerns: Does not validate units or ensure min_interval > 0 beyond simple numeric check, risking ZeroDivision exceptions if misconfigured.
opportunities: Introduce dataclass validation or schema enforcement for throttle profiles before computation.
nodes.notes: Helps enforce conservative RPS when specific endpoints require tighter throttles.

nodes.name: SessionManager._check_cached_readiness
nodes.summary: Applies timeout-guarded cache validation to reuse recent readiness checks when safe.
nodes.mechanism: Decorators enforce timeout and graceful degradation while method compares last readiness timestamp, validates driver health when browser needed, and returns cached boolean when valid.
concerns: Fixed 60-second cache window may be too lenient for volatile sessions, allowing stale readiness state.
opportunities: Expose configurable cache duration or action-specific overrides before reusing readiness state.
nodes.notes: Returns None when cache unusable so caller proceeds with full validation path.

nodes.name: SessionManager._check_cookies_available

nodes.name: SessionManager._clear_session_caches

nodes.name: SessionManager._close_browser

nodes.name: SessionManager._deduplicate_cookies

nodes.name: SessionManager._determine_success_threshold
nodes.summary: Resolve success threshold with configuration overrides.

nodes.name: SessionManager._ensure_metrics_exporter
nodes.summary: Start Prometheus metrics exporter when metrics are enabled.

nodes.name: SessionManager._finalize_recovered_session_state
nodes.summary: Ensure cookies/CSRF are available before declaring recovery success.

nodes.name: SessionManager._force_cookie_resync
nodes.summary: Force a cookie resync when authentication errors occur.

nodes.name: SessionManager._force_session_restart
nodes.summary: Emergency restart routine invoked by APICallWatchdog when operations hang beyond timeout.
nodes.mechanism: Performs aggressive cleanup of browser, database connections, API caches, CSRF tokens, and session flags before marking session invalid.
concerns: Returns False unconditionally; callers must rely on side effects to detect restart.
opportunities: Consider emitting analytics event summarizing restart reason for telemetry.
nodes.notes: Backed by regression tests to guard against 7-hour hang recurrence.

nodes.name: SessionManager._initialize_rate_limiter
nodes.summary: Configures and attaches the AdaptiveRateLimiter instance based on runtime configuration and endpoint profiles.
nodes.mechanism: Imports utils.get_rate_limiter lazily, derives batch and fill-rate thresholds from config_schema, applies endpoint caps, and logs when limiter bound to session.
concerns: Performs multiple getattr lookups without validation; typos in config can silently fall back to defaults.
Swallows ImportError by returning None, leaving callers without explicit warning that rate limiting is disabled.
opportunities: Emit warning when limiter cannot be created so operators know rate limiting is inactive.
Expose resulting configuration object for telemetry to confirm expected thresholds.
nodes.notes: Called once during SessionManager init to honor REQUESTS_PER_SECOND and endpoint throttles.

opportunities: Could expose structured status object instead of boolean for richer analytics.

nodes.name: SessionValidator.__init__
nodes.summary: Initialize the SessionValidator.

nodes.name: SessionValidator._attempt_relogin
nodes.summary: Delegates to utils.log_in to re-establish browser-authenticated session when needed.
nodes.mechanism: Imports log_in lazily, invokes with session_manager, and interprets LOGIN_SUCCEEDED string response as success.
concerns: Return contract tied to magic string responses; upstream changes could silently break relogin detection.
opportunities: Adopt structured LoginResult enum to avoid string comparisons and convey detailed failure causes.
nodes.notes: Logs failures at error level to surface multi-attempt relogin issues.

nodes.name: SessionValidator._check_and_handle_url
nodes.summary: Validates current browser URL is within configured Ancestry domain and navigates home when off-track.
nodes.mechanism: Inspects driver.current_url, compares to config_schema.api.base_url, and uses utils.nav_to_page to redirect when necessary.
concerns: Assumes browser_manager.driver is available and responsive; no fallback if driver attribute missing.
opportunities: Accept expected URL prefix parameter to support regional domains or staging environments.
nodes.notes: Treats navigation failure as readiness failure, prompting outer retry loop.

nodes.name: SessionValidator._check_csrf_token
nodes.summary: Ensures APIManager caches CSRF token while tolerating retrieval failures for non-critical actions.
nodes.mechanism: Requests new CSRF token when missing, logs warnings on failure, and treats errors as non-blocking by returning True with None message.
concerns: Suppressing CSRF fetch failures may hide genuine authentication regressions.
opportunities: Track failure counts separately so repeated CSRF issues trigger proactive session refresh.
nodes.notes: Pairs with SessionManager._precache_csrf_token for pre-fetch optimization.

nodes.name: SessionValidator._check_essential_cookies
nodes.summary: Verifies presence of OptanonConsent and trees cookies unless heuristics skip the check.
nodes.mechanism: Invokes _should_skip_cookie_check, then relies on BrowserManager.get_cookies to confirm required names and logs warning when missing.
concerns: Essential cookie list hard-coded; future platform changes may require additional cookie checks.
opportunities: Read essential cookie names from configuration to adapt across regions or product updates.
nodes.notes: Returns (success, reason) tuple so caller can log skip justification.

nodes.name: SessionValidator._check_login_and_attempt_relogin
nodes.summary: Confirms Ancestry login and triggers relogin via utils when session expired.
nodes.mechanism: Imports utils.login_status lazily, checks API login with disable_ui_fallback, and if false calls _attempt_relogin to reauthenticate before proceeding.
concerns: Hard dependency on utils.login_status and log_in while avoiding circular imports hides coupling.
Relogin failure returns generic message without reason from login flow, challenging troubleshooting.
opportunities: Refactor login helpers into dedicated auth module to remove late imports and clarify responsibilities.
Bubble up LoginResult enums so callers can handle MFA, captcha, or outage scenarios differently.
nodes.notes: Returns (success, message) to outer coordination method.

nodes.name: SessionValidator._ensure_on_base_url
nodes.summary: Ensure the browser is on the correct base URL before login checks.

nodes.name: SessionValidator._handle_check_exception
nodes.summary: Normalizes exceptions encountered during readiness attempts, signaling when to abort retries.
nodes.mechanism: If WebDriverException occurs, logs and checks driver health to decide abort; otherwise logs unexpected exception with traceback and advises retry.
concerns: Relies on BrowserManager.is_session_valid side effects; return value alone may miss partial driver corruption.
opportunities: Attach structured error codes to differentiate WebDriver failures vs. logic errors for analytics.
nodes.notes: Returns tuple (should_abort, message) consumed by perform_readiness_checks.

nodes.name: SessionValidator._perform_all_checks
nodes.summary: Executes ordered readiness steps covering login, navigation, cookies, sync, and CSRF token acquisition.
nodes.mechanism: Calls _check_login_and_attempt_relogin, _check_and_handle_url, _check_essential_cookies, _sync_cookies_to_requests, and optionally _check_csrf_token, short-circuiting on failure.
concerns: Action_name skip heuristics baked into cookie check reduce reuse outside current action set.
opportunities: Allow dependency injection for each stage to facilitate targeted testing or customization.
nodes.notes: Returns tuple of success flag and message consumed by outer retry loop.

nodes.name: SessionValidator._process_login_result
nodes.summary: Interpret login_status result and perform relogin if necessary.

nodes.name: SessionValidator._should_skip_cookie_check
nodes.summary: Determines whether essential cookie validation can be bypassed for given action names.
nodes.mechanism: Compares lowercased action_name against predefined substring map returning skip flag and justification string.
concerns: String containment rules risk false positives/negatives when action labels change or overlap.
opportunities: Share action identifiers via central registry so skip conditions stay synchronized with menu definitions.
nodes.notes: Supports legacy aliases (coord, srch_inbox) to bridge historical command variants.

nodes.name: SessionValidator._sync_cookies_for_login
nodes.summary: Force a cookie sync before login verification when available.

nodes.name: SessionValidator._sync_cookies_to_requests
nodes.summary: Bridges BrowserManager cookies into APIManager's pooled requests session with recovery awareness.
nodes.mechanism: Calls APIManager.sync_cookies_from_browser passing through session_manager for retry support and surfaces success flag with error message.
concerns: Returns False on failure without capturing which cookie caused issues or whether recovery ran.
opportunities: Emit structured event including cookie counts and recovery path to aid monitoring.
nodes.notes: Central fix ensures session_manager forwarded so APIManager can trigger recovery.

nodes.name: SessionValidator._verify_cookies_and_sync
nodes.summary: Validate browser cookies and synchronize them to API sessions.

nodes.name: SessionValidator._verify_csrf_if_needed
nodes.summary: Optionally validate CSRF tokens when required.

nodes.name: SessionValidator._verify_login_and_url
nodes.summary: Ensure login is valid and URL state is acceptable.

nodes.name: SessionValidator.perform_readiness_checks
nodes.summary: Runs readiness stages with bounded retry attempts before declaring the shared session unhealthy.
nodes.mechanism: Loops up to max_attempts invoking _perform_all_checks, handles exceptions via _handle_check_exception, sleeps 5 seconds between tries, and logs final error message when all attempts fail.
concerns: Returns only boolean outcome; caller loses context on which stage failed last.
Catches broad Exception, potentially masking programmer errors during readiness path.
opportunities: Return dataclass containing status per check and final failure reason for richer recovery decisions.
Differentiate fatal vs. retryable exceptions to avoid wasting attempts on fatal states.
nodes.notes: Default max_attempts=3 with fixed 5s delay; skip_csrf flag bypasses CSRF retrieval for file-based workflows.

nodes.name: SessionValidator.validate_session_cookies
nodes.summary: Utility wrapper verifying required cookie names exist when browser session is valid.
nodes.mechanism: Checks BrowserManager.is_session_valid before delegating to get_cookies, returning False on exceptions.
concerns: Swallows detailed cookie lookup errors, emitting only generic exception message in logs.
opportunities: Return missing cookie names for faster diagnosis of partial cookie sets.
nodes.notes: Used by integration tests to assert essential cookies present.

nodes.name: SessionValidator.verify_login_status
nodes.summary: Confirms login via APIManager with optional cookie sync support from SessionManager.
nodes.mechanism: Calls APIManager.verify_api_login_status, interprets tri-state response, and logs unexpected exceptions as failures.
concerns: Returns False for both explicit logout and unexpected errors; caller must inspect logs to differentiate.
opportunities: Return enum capturing success/failure/critical to clarify upstream handling.
nodes.notes: Complements readiness checks by offering standalone login verification helper.

nodes.summary: Finalizes suite execution, prints aggregate results, and returns boolean success flag.
nodes.mechanism: Calculates elapsed time, formats summary tables, logs pass/fail counts, and indicates overall success to callers.
opportunities: Emit machine-readable summary for CI ingestion.
nodes.notes: Return value is widely used to set process exit codes.

nodes.name: TestSuite.run_test
nodes.summary: Executes a single test callable with standardized logging and exception handling.
nodes.mechanism: Wraps invocation in try/except, records pass/fail, captures duration, and prints formatted status lines with optional metadata.
concerns: Inline formatting logic is extensive and could be modularized.
opportunities: Support async test callables for IO-bound checks.
nodes.notes: Used by every module ordering tests into the suite.

nodes.name: TestSuite.start_suite
nodes.summary: Initializes suite timing and logs header information prior to test execution.
nodes.mechanism: Sets start timestamp, prints formatted suite banner, and resets counters before individual tests run.
opportunities: Allow dependency injection for output stream to simplify testing.
nodes.notes: Called by module test harnesses before registering cases.
